Synthesis	O
of	O
thrombin	O
-	O
inhibiting	O
heparin	O
mimetics	O
without	O
side	O
effects	O
.	O

Unwanted	O
side	O
effects	O
of	O
pharmacologically	O
active	O
compounds	O
can	O
usually	O
be	O
eliminated	O
by	O
structural	O
modifications	O
.	O

But	O
the	O
complex	O

structure	O
of	O
the	O
polysaccharide	O
heparin	O
has	O
limited	O
this	O
approach	O
to	O

,	O

to	O
slightly	O
better	O
-	O
tolerated	O
heparin	O
preparations	O
of	O
low	O

mass	O
.	O

Despite	O
this	O
improvement	O
,	O
heparin	O
-	O
induced	O
thrombocytopaenia	O
(	O

)	O
,	O
related	O
to	O
an	O

(	O

,	O

,	O
remain	O
significant	O
side	O
effects	O
of	O
heparinotherapy	O
.	O

Breakthroughs	O
in	O
oligosaccharide	O
chemistry	O
made	O
possible	O
the	O
total	O
synthesis	O
of	O
the	O
pentasaccharide	O

-	O
binding	O
site	O
of	O
heparin	O
.	O

This	O
pentasaccharide	O
represents	O
a	O
new	O
family	O
of	O
potential	O
antithrombotic	O
drugs	O
,	O
devoid	O
of	O

inhibitory	O
properties	O
,	O
and	O
free	O
of	O

with	O

and	O
vessel	O
components	O
.	O

To	O

more	O
potent	O
and	O
well	O
-	O

antithrombotic	O
drugs	O

we	O

to	O
inhibit	O
thrombin	O
,	O
that	O
is	O

longer	O
oligosaccharides	O
.	O

Like	O
thrombin	O

,	O
undesired	O

are	O

to	O

of	O
the	O
molecules	O

,	O
particularly	O

.	O

Here	O

.	O

BACKGROUND	O
&	O

:	O

critical	O
role	O
of	O

(	O

)	O
products	O
in	O

of	O
renal	O
function	O
in	O
cirrhosis	O

in	O
this	O

.	O

-	I-chem

.	O

Determinants	O
of	O
voltage	O
-	O
dependent	O
inactivation	O
affect	O
Mibefradil	S-chem
block	O
of	O
calcium	S-chem
channels	O
.	O

The	O
voltage	O
gated	O
calcium	S-chem
channel	O
family	O
is	O
a	O
major	O
target	O
for	O
a	O
range	O
of	O
therapeutic	O
drugs	O
.	O

Mibefradil	S-chem
(	O
Ro	B-chem
40	I-chem
-	I-chem
5967	E-chem
)	O
belongs	O
to	O
a	O
new	O
chemical	O
class	O
of	O
these	O
molecules	O
which	O
differs	O
from	O
other	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
antagonists	O

its	O
ability	O
to	O
potently	O
block	O
T	O
-	O
type	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
channels	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
this	O
molecule	O
has	O
also	O
been	O
shown	O
to	O
inhibit	O
other	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
channel	O
subtypes	O
.	O

To	O
further	O
analyze	O
the	O
mechanism	O
governing	O
the	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
channel	O
-	O
Mibefradil	S-chem
interaction	O
,	O
we	O
examined	O
the	O
effect	O
of	O
Mibefradil	S-chem
on	O
various	O
recombinant	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
channels	O
expressed	O
in	O
mammalian	O
cells	O
from	O
their	O
cloned	O
cDNAs	O
,	O
using	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
as	O
the	O
permeant	O
ion	O
at	O
physiological	O
concentration	O
.	O

Expression	O
of	O
alpha1A	O
,	O

of	O

The	O
Hsp90	O

inhibitor	O
geldanamycin	S-chem

The	O
90	O
-	O
kDa	O
heat	O
shock	O
protein	O
(	O
Hsp90	O
)	O
is	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

Its	O

in	O
folding	O
nascent	O
proteins	O
seems	O
to	O
be	O
restricted	O
to	O
a	O
subset	O
of	O
proteins	O
including	O
major	O
components	O
of	O
signal	O

(	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

Improper	O
function	O
of	O
these	O

can	O
be	O
induced	O
by	O
selective	O

of	O
their	O

with	O

ansamycin	E-chem
geldanamycin	S-chem
.	O

that	O

treatment	O

of	O

of	O

Carnitine	S-chem
biosynthesis	O
.	O

of	O
gamma	B-chem
-	I-chem
butyrobetaine	E-chem
hydroxylase	O

.	O

gamma	B-chem
-	I-chem
Butyrobetaine	E-chem
hydroxylase	O
catalyse	O
the	O
last	O
step	O
in	O

biosynthesis	O
,	O

formation	O
of	O
L	B-chem
-	I-chem
carnitine	E-chem
from	O
gamma	B-chem
-	I-chem
butyrobetaine	E-chem
,	O
a	O
reaction	O
dependent	O
on	O
Fe2	B-chem
+	E-chem
,	O
alpha	B-chem
-	I-chem
ketoglutarate	E-chem
,	O
ascorbate	S-chem
and	O
oxygen	S-chem
.	O

Initial	O
attempts	O
to	O
purify	O
the	O
protein	O
from	O
rat	O
liver	O
showed	O
that	O
gamma	B-chem
-	I-chem

hydroxylase	O
is	O

.	O

We	O

therefore	O

the	O

of	O
various	O
compounds	O
on	O

of	O
gamma	B-chem
-	I-chem
butyrobetaine	E-chem
hydroxylase	O
at	O

.	O

The	O
enzyme	O
activity	O
was	O
best	O
conserved	O
by	O

the	O
protein	O
at	O
4	O
degrees	O

of	O

g	O
/	O

and	O
10	O
mM	O
DTT	S-chem
.	O

We	O
subsequently	O
purified	O
the	O
enzyme	O
from	O
rat	O
liver	O
to	O
apparent	O
homogeneity	O
by	O
liquid	O
chromatography	O
.	O

Aspirin	S-chem
and	O
sodium	B-chem
salicylate	E-chem
inhibit	O
endothelin	O
ETA	O
receptors	O
by	O
an	O
allosteric	O
type	O
of	O
mechanism	O
.	O

Aspirin	S-chem
is	O
a	O
commonly	O
used	O
drug	O
with	O
a	O
wide	O
pharmacological	O
spectrum	O
including	O
antiplatelet	O
,	O
anti	O
-	O
inflammatory	O
,	O
and	O
neuroprotective	O
actions	O
.	O

This	O
study	O
shows	O
that	O
aspirin	S-chem
and	O
sodium	B-chem
salicylate	E-chem
,	O
its	O
major	O
blood	O
metabolite	O
,	O
reverse	O
contractile	O
actions	O
of	O
endothelin	O
-	O
1	O
(	O
ET	O
-	O
1	O
)	O
in	O
isolated	O
rat	O
aorta	O
and	O
human	O
mammary	O
arteries	O
.	O

They	O
also	O
prevent	O

A	O
unique	O

activity	O
related	O
but	O

from	O

catalyses	O
metabolic	O
activation	O
of	O
mitomycin	B-chem
C	E-chem
.	O

Mitomycin	B-chem
C	E-chem
(	O
MMC	S-chem
)	O
is	O
a	O
prototype	O
bioreductive	O
drug	O
employed	O
to	O
treat	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
cancers	O
including	O
head	O
and	O
neck	O
cancer	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
various	O
enzymes	O
,	O
dicoumarol	S-chem
inhibitable	O
cytosolic	O
NAD	B-chem
(	I-chem
P	I-chem
)	I-chem
H	E-chem
:	O
quinone	S-chem
oxidoreductase1	O
(	O
NQO1	O
)	O
was	O
shown	O
to	O
catalyse	O
bioreductive	O
activation	O
of	O
MMC	S-chem
leading	O
to	O
cross	O
-	O
linking	O
of	O
the	O
DNA	O
and	O
cytotoxicity	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
role	O
of	O
NQO1	O
in	O
metabolic	O
activation	O
of	O
MMC	S-chem
has	O
been	O
disputed	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
report	O
,	O
we	O
present	O
cellular	O
and	O
animal	O
models	O
to	O
demonstrate	O
that	O

may	O
play	O
only	O
a	O

role	O
in	O
metabolic	O
activation	O
of	O
MMC	S-chem
.	O

We	O
further	O
demonstrate	O
that	O
bioreductive	O
activation	O
of	O
MMC	S-chem
is	O
catalysed	O
by	O
a	O
unique	O
cytosolic	O
activity	O
which	O
is	O
related	O
but	O
distinct	O
from	O
NQO1	O
.	O

Chinese	O
hamster	O
ovary	O
(	O
CHO	O
)	O
cells	O
were	O
developed	O
that	O
permanently	O
express	O

of	O

.	O

These	O

against	O

.	O

However	O

to	O

higher	O

due	O
to	O
exposure	O
to	O
MMC	S-chem
under	O
oxygen	S-chem
(	O
normal	O
air	O
)	O
or	O
hypoxia	O
,	O
as	O
compared	O
to	O
the	O
wild	O
-	O
type	O
control	O
CHO	O
cells	O
.	O

Disruption	O
of	O
the	O
NQO1	O
gene	O
by	O

.	O

The	O

fractions	O
from	O

of	O

of	O

to	O
MMC	S-chem
,	O

in	O
NQO1	O
+	O
/	O
+	O
mice	O
.	O

The	O
unique	O

that	O
activated	O

in	O
cytosolic	O
fractions	O
of	O

and	O

to	O

.	O

The	O
apoptosome	O
:	O
heart	O
and	O
soul	O
of	O
the	O
cell	O
death	O
machine	O
.	O

Apoptosis	O
is	O
a	O
fundamental	O
biologic	O
process	O
by	O
which	O
metazoan	O
cells	O
orchestrate	O
their	O
own	O
self	O
-	O
demise	O
.	O

Genetic	O
analyses	O
of	O
the	O
nematode	O
C	O
elegans	O
identified	O
three	O
core	O
components	O
of	O
the	O
suicide	O
apparatus	O
which	O
include	O
CED	O
-	O
3	O
,	O
CED	O
-	O
4	O
,	O
and	O
CED	O
-	O
9	O
.	O

An	O
analogous	O
set	O
of	O
core	O
constituents	O
exists	O
in	O
mammalian	O
cells	O
and	O
includes	O
caspase	O
-	O
9	O
,	O
Apaf	O
-	O
1	O
,	O
and	O
bcl	O
-	O
2	O
/	O
xL	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

CED	O
-	O
3	O
and	O
CED	O
-	O
4	O
,	O
along	O
with	O
their	O
mammalian	O
counterparts	O
,	O
function	O
to	O
kill	O
cells	O
,	O
whereas	O
CED	O
-	O
9	O
and	O
its	O
mammalian	O
equivalents	O
protect	O
cells	O
from	O
death	O
.	O

These	O
central	O
components	O
biochemically	O
intermingle	O
in	O
a	O
ternary	O
complex	O
recently	O
dubbed	O
the	O
``	O
apoptosome.	O
``	O
The	O
C	O
elegans	O
protein	O
EGL	O
-	O
1	O
and	O
its	O
mammalian	O
counterparts	O
,	O
pro	O
-	O
apoptotic	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
bcl	O
-	O
2	O
family	O
,	O
induce	O
cell	O
death	O
by	O
disrupting	O
apoptosome	O
interactions	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
EGL	O
-	O
1	O
may	O
represent	O
a	O
primordial	O
signal	O
integrator	O
for	O
the	O
apoptosome	O
.	O

Various	O
biochemical	O
processes	O
including	O
oligomerization	O
,	O
adenosine	B-chem
triphosphate	E-chem
ATP	S-chem
/	O
dATP	O
binding	O
,	O
and	O
cytochrome	O
c	O
interaction	O
play	O
a	O
role	O
in	O
regulating	O
the	O
ternary	O
death	O
complex	O
.	O

Recent	O
studies	O
suggest	O
that	O
cell	O
death	O
receptors	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
CD95	O
,	O
may	O
amplify	O
their	O
suicide	O
signal	O
by	O
activating	O
the	O
apoptosome	O
.	O

These	O
mutual	O
associations	O
by	O
core	O
components	O
of	O
the	O
suicide	O
apparatus	O
provide	O
a	O
molecular	O
framework	O
in	O
which	O
diverse	O
death	O
signals	O
likely	O
interface	O
.	O

Understanding	O
the	O
apoptosome	O
and	O
its	O
cellular	O
connections	O
will	O
facilitate	O
the	O
design	O
of	O
novel	O

strategies	O
for	O
cancer	O
and	O
other	O
disease	O
states	O
in	O
which	O
apoptosis	O
plays	O
a	O
pivotal	O
role	O
.	O

[	O

(	I-chem

)	E-chem

(	O

.	O

Suppression	O
of	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
activity	O
by	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
is	O
mediated	O
by	O

of	O
IkappaB	O
kinases	O
alpha	O
and	O
beta	O
.	O

BACKGROUND	O
&	O
AIMS	O
:	O
Activation	O
of	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
/	O
Rel	O
has	O
been	O
implicated	O
in	O
the	O
pathogenesis	O
of	O
inflammatory	O
bowel	O
disease	O
(	O
IBD	O
)	O
.	O

Various	O
drugs	O
used	O
in	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
IBD	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
glucocorticoids	O
,	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
aminosalicylic	I-chem
acid	E-chem
,	O
and	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
,	O
interfere	O
with	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
/	O
Rel	O
signaling	O
.	O

The	O
aim	O
of	O
this	O
study	O
was	O
to	O
define	O
the	O
molecular	O
mechanism	O
by	O
which	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
inhibits	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
activation	O
.	O

METHODS	O
:	O
The	O
effects	O
of	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
and	O
its	O
moieties	O
on	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
signaling	O
were	O
evaluated	O
using	O
electromobility	O
shift	O
,	O
transfection	O
,	O
and	O
immune	O
complex	O
kinase	O
assays	O
.	O

The	O
direct	O
effect	O
of	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
on	O
IkappaB	O
kinase	O
(	O
IKK	O
)	O
activity	O
was	O
investigated	O
using	O
purified	O
recombinant	O
IKK	O
-	O
alpha	O
and	O
-	O
beta	O
proteins	O
.	O

RESULTS	O
:	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
/	O
Rel	O
activity	O
induced	O
by	O
tumor	O
necrosis	O
factor	O
alpha	O
,	O
12	B-chem
-	I-chem
O	I-chem
-	I-chem
tetradecanoylphorbol	I-chem
-	I-chem
13	I-chem
-	I-chem
acetate	E-chem
,	O
or	O
overexpression	O
of	O
NF	O
-	O
kappaB	O
-	O
inducing	O
kinase	O
,	O
IKK	O
-	O
alpha	O
,	O
IKK	O
-	O
beta	O
,	O
or	O
constitutively	O
active	O
IKK	O
-	O
alpha	O
and	O
IKK	O
-	O
beta	O
mutants	O
was	O
inhibited	O
dose	O
dependently	O
by	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
.	O

Sulfasalazine	S-chem
inhibited	O
tumor	O
necrosis	O
factor	O
alpha	O
-	O
induced	O
activation	O
of	O
endogenous	O
IKK	O
in	O
Jurkat	O
T	O
cells	O
and	O
SW620	O
colon	O
cells	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
the	O
catalytic	O
activity	O
of	O
purified	O
IKK	O
-	O
alpha	O
and	O
IKK	O
-	O
beta	O
in	O
vitro	O
.	O

In	O
contrast	O
,	O
the	O
moieties	O
of	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
,	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
aminosalicylic	I-chem
acid	E-chem
,	O
and	O
sulfapyridine	S-chem
or	O
4	B-chem
-	I-chem
aminosalicylic	I-chem
acid	E-chem
had	O
no	O
effect	O
.	O

Activation	O
of	O
extracellular	O
signal	O
-	O
related	O
kinase	O
(	O
ERK	O
)	O
1	O
and	O
2	O
,	O
c	O
-	O
Jun	O
-	O
N	S-chem
-	O
terminal	O
kinase	O
(	O
JNK	O
)	O
1	O
,	O
and	O
p38	O
was	O
unaffected	O
by	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
.	O

The	O
decrease	O
in	O
substrate	O
phosphorylation	O
by	O
IKK	O
-	O
alpha	O
and	O
-	O
beta	O
is	O
associated	O
with	O
a	O
decrease	O
in	O
autophosphorylation	O
of	O
IKKs	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
antagonized	O
by	O
excess	O
adenosine	B-chem
triphosphate	E-chem
.	O

CONCLUSIONS	O
:	O
These	O
data	O
identify	O
sulfasalazine	S-chem
as	O
a	O
direct	O
inhibitor	O
of	O
IKK	O
-	O
alpha	O
and	O
-	O
beta	O
by	O
antagonizing	O
adenosine	B-chem
triphosphate	E-chem
binding	O
.	O

.	O

of	O

(	O

)	O

2	O

carcinogen	O

of	O

.	O

Pseudohypoaldosteronism	O
type	O
1	O
(	O

)	O
is	O

to	O

.	O

-	O
sensitive	O

sodium	S-chem
channel	O

and	O
the	O
autosomal	O
dominant	O
or	O
sporadic	O
form	O
,	O
which	O
shows	O
milder	O
symptoms	O
that	O
remit	O
with	O
age	O
.	O

Mutations	O
in	O
the	O
gene	O
encoding	O
the	O
human	O
mineralocorticoid	O
receptor	O
(	O
hMR	O
)	O

,	O

least	O
in	O
some	O
patients	O

for	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

We	O
here	O
report	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
a	O
genetic	O
study	O
in	O
a	O
sporadic	O
case	O
and	O
in	O
5	O
affected	O
patients	O
from	O
2	O
families	O
with	O
autosomal	O
dominant	O

.	O

In	O
the	O

case	O
we	O
identified	O
a	O
new	O
frameshift	O

,	O
Ins2871C	O

in	O
exon	O
9	O
of	O
the	O

gene	O
.	O

Family	O
members	O

and	O
had	O
no	O

.	O

This	O
mutation	O
is	O
the	O
first	O
described	O
in	O
exon	O
9	O
and	O
impairs	O
the	O
last	O
27	O
amino	B-chem
acids	E-chem
of	O
the	O
hormone	O
-	O
binding	O
domain	O
.	O

In	O
2	O
kindreds	O
with	O
autosomal	O
dominant	O
PHA1	O
we	O
found	O
no	O
mutation	O
of	O
the	O
hMR	O
gene	O
.	O

Our	O
results	O
confirm	O
the	O

that	O

or	O

is	O

.	O

of	O
AS	B-chem
-	I-chem
8112	E-chem

Rofecoxib	S-chem
:	O
a	O
review	O
of	O
its	O
use	O
in	O
the	O
management	O
of	O
osteoarthritis	O
,	O
acute	O
pain	O
and	O
rheumatoid	O
arthritis	O
.	O

Rofecoxib	S-chem
is	O
a	O
selective	O

-	O

(	O
COX	O
)	O
-	O
2	O
inhibitor	O
which	O
has	O
little	O

on	O
the	O

-	O
1	O
isoenzyme	O
at	O
doses	O
up	O
to	O
1000	O
mg	O
/	O
day	O
.	O

Rofecoxib	S-chem
has	O
greater	O
selectivity	O
for	O
COX	O
-	O
2	O
than	O
celecoxib	S-chem
,	O
meloxicam	S-chem
,	O
diclofenac	S-chem
and	O
indomethacin	S-chem
.	O

In	O

-	O

,	O
rofecoxib	S-chem
12.5	O
to	O
500	O
mg	O
/	O
day	O
has	O
been	O
evaluated	O
for	O
its	O
efficacy	O
in	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
osteoarthritis	O
,	O
acute	O
pain	O
and	O
rheumatoid	O
arthritis	O
[	O

(	O
5	O
to	O

mg	O
/	O
day	O
)	O
were	O
generally	O
used	O
in	O
the	O

.	O

In	O
the	O

of	O
patients	O
with	O

,	O
rofecoxib	S-chem
was	O
more	O

in	O

than	O

,	O

(	O

)	O
and	O
celecoxib	S-chem

was	O

in	O

to	O
ibuprofen	S-chem
,	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

.	O

was	O

Clinical	O
,	O

and	O
molecular	O
genetic	O
data	O
in	O
five	O
children	O
with	O
Gitelman	O
's	O
syndrome	O
.	O

Gitelman	O
's	O
variant	O
of	O
Bartter	O
's	O
syndrome	O
,	O
inherited	O
hypokalemic	O
alkalosis	O
,	O
is	O

by	O

in	O
the	O
thiazide	S-chem
-	O
sensitive	O
NaCl	S-chem
co	O
-	O
transporter	O
(	O
NCCT	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
main	O

are	O
:	O

,	O

,	O

and	O
short	O

.	O

The	O
diagnosis	O
was	O

in	O
five	O
children	O
according	O
to	O
clinical	O
criteria	O
.	O

All	O
patients	O
exhibited	O

spasm	O
during	O
febrile	O
illness	O
,	O
three	O
patients	O
had	O
short	O
stature	O
.	O

Biochemical	O
features	O
were	O
:	O

,	O

,	O
hypomagnesemia	O
,	O
low	O
IGF	O
-	O

levels	O
,	O

,	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

Three	O
patients	O
had	O

plasma	O
renin	O
activity	O
and	O

.	O

Mutational	O
analysis	O
of	O
the	O
NCCT	O
gene	O
confirmed	O
the	O
diagnosis	O
in	O
all	O
five	O
patients	O
.	O

Different	O
forms	O
of	O
therapy	O
,	O
potassium	S-chem
and	O
magnesium	S-chem
substitution	O
,	O
spironolactone	S-chem
and	O
indomethacin	S-chem
failed	O
to	O
fully	O
correct	O

and	O
hypomagnesemia	O

but	O
markedly	O
improved	O
growth	O
velocity	O
and	O
normalized	O

-	O

levels	O
in	O
the	O
three	O
patients	O
with	O
short	O
stature	O
.	O

During	O
therapy	O
,	O
clinical	O
symptoms	O
disappeared	O
.	O

We	O
conclude	O
that	O
Gitelman	O
's	O
syndrome	O
is	O
a	O
disorder	O
with	O
a	O
variable	O
symptom	O
profile	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
be	O
suspected	O
on	O
clinical	O
signs	O
already	O
in	O
early	O
childhood	O
.	O

The	O
early	O
diagnosis	O
is	O
essential	O
in	O
preventing	O
complications	O
.	O

Peroxisome	O
proliferator	O
-	O
activated	O
receptor	O
subtype	O
-	O
specific	O
regulation	O
of	O
hepatic	O
and	O

gene	O
expression	O
in	O
the	O
Zucker	O
diabetic	O
fatty	O
rat	O
.	O

Fibrates	S-chem
and	O
thiazolidinediones	S-chem
are	O
used	O
clinically	O
to	O
treat	O
hypertriglyceridemia	O
and	O
hyperglycemia	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

Fibrates	S-chem
bind	O
to	O
the	O
peroxisome	O
proliferator	O
-	O
activated	O
receptor	O
(	O
PPAR	O
)	O
-	O
alpha	O
,	O
and	O
thiazolidinediones	S-chem
are	O

Salicylic	B-chem

)	O

3H	I-chem
]	I-chem
dofetilide	E-chem

assay	O

Effects	O
of	O
the	O

/	O

drug	O

and	O

in	O
rat	O

.	O

1	O
.	O

Phenelzine	S-chem
(	O
PLZ	S-chem
)	O
is	O
an	O
antidepressant	O
with	O
anxiolytic	O
properties	O
.	O

Acute	O
and	O
chronic	O
PLZ	S-chem
administration	O
increase	O
brain	O
GABA	S-chem
levels	O
,	O
an	O
effect	O
due	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
in	O
part	O
,	O
to	O
an	O
inhibition	O
of	O
the	O
activity	O
of	O
the	O
GABA	S-chem
metabolizing	O
enzyme	O
,	O
GABA	S-chem
transaminase	O
(	O
GABA	O
-	O
T	O
)	O
.	O

2	O
.	O

Previous	O
preliminary	O
reports	O
have	O
indicated	O
that	O
acute	O
PLZ	S-chem
treatment	O
also	O
elevates	O
brain	O
alanine	S-chem
levels	O
.	O

As	O
with	O
GABA	S-chem
,	O
the	O
metabolism	O
of	O
alanine	S-chem
involves	O
a	O
pyridoxal	B-chem
phosphate	E-chem
-	O
dependent	O
transaminase	O
.	O

3	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
study	O
reported	O
here	O
,	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
acute	O
PLZ	S-chem
treatment	O
on	O
the	O
levels	O
of	O
various	O
amino	B-chem
acids	E-chem
,	O
some	O
of	O
which	O
are	O
also	O
metabolized	O
by	O
pyridoxal	B-chem
phosphate	E-chem
-	O
dependent	O
transaminases	O
were	O
compared	O
in	O
rat	O
whole	O
brain	O
.	O

Of	O
the	O
6	O
amino	B-chem
acids	E-chem
investigated	O
,	O
only	O
GABA	S-chem
and	O
alanine	S-chem
levels	O
were	O
elevated	O
(	O
in	O
a	O
time	O
-	O
and	O
dose	O
-	O
dependent	O
manner	O
)	O
.	O

4	O
.	O

The	O
elevation	O
in	O
brain	O
alanine	S-chem
levels	O
could	O
be	O
explained	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
in	O
part	O
,	O
by	O
a	O
time	O
-	O
and	O
dose	O
-	O
dependent	O

effect	O
of	O

on	O
alanine	S-chem

(	O

are	O

from	O

.	O

of	O

.	O

5	O
.	O

of	O

.	O

Nicotine	S-chem
-	O

of	O
VWD	O
.	O

Differential	O
binding	O
mode	O
of	O
diverse	O
cyclooxygenase	O
inhibitors	O
.	O

Non	O
-	O
steroidal	S-chem
anti	O
-	O
inflammatory	O
drugs	O
(	O
NSAIDs	O
)	O
are	O
competitive	O
inhibitors	O
of	O
cyclooxygenase	O
(	O
COX	O
)	O
,	O
the	O
enzyme	O
that	O
mediates	O
biosynthesis	O
of	O
prostaglandins	S-chem
and	O
thromboxanes	S-chem
from	O
arachidonic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
.	O

There	O
are	O
at	O
least	O
two	O
different	O
isoforms	O
of	O
the	O
enzyme	O
known	O
as	O
COX	O
-	O
1	O
and	O
-	O
2	O
.	O

Site	O
directed	O
mutagenesis	O
studies	O
suggest	O
that	O
non	O
-	O
selective	O
COX	O
inhibitors	O
of	O
diverse	O
chemical	O
families	O
exhibit	O
differential	O
binding	O
modes	O
to	O
the	O
two	O
isozymes	O
.	O

These	O
results	O
can	O
not	O
clearly	O
be	O
explained	O
from	O
the	O
sole	O
analysis	O
of	O
the	O
crystal	O
structures	O
of	O
COX	O
available	O
from	O
X	O
-	O
ray	O
diffraction	O
studies	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
aim	O
to	O
elucidate	O
the	O
structural	O
features	O
governing	O
the	O
differential	O
inhibitory	O
binding	O
behavior	O
of	O
these	O
inhibitors	O
,	O
molecular	O
modeling	O
studies	O
were	O
undertaken	O
to	O
generate	O
atomic	O
models	O
compatible	O
with	O
the	O
experimental	O
data	O
available	O
.	O

Accordingly	O
,	O
docking	O
of	O
different	O
COX	O
inhibitors	O
,	O
including	O
selective	O
and	O
non	O
-	O
selective	O
ligands	O
:	O
rofecoxib	S-chem
,	O
ketoprofen	S-chem
,	O
suprofen	S-chem
,	O
carprofen	S-chem
,	O
zomepirac	S-chem
,	O
indomethacin	S-chem
,	O
diclofenac	S-chem
and	O
meclofenamic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
were	O
undertaken	O
using	O
the	O
AMBER	O
program	O
.	O

The	O
results	O
of	O
the	O
present	O
study	O
provide	O
new	O
insights	O
into	O
a	O
better	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
differential	O
binding	O
mode	O
of	O
diverse	O
families	O
of	O
COX	O
inhibitors	O
,	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
contribute	O
to	O
the	O
design	O
of	O
new	O
selective	O
compounds	O
.	O

Pure	O
antiestrogens	O
and	O
breast	O
cancer	O
.	O

Tamoxifen	S-chem
,	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
commonly	O
used	O
drug	O
for	O
treatment	O
of	O
breast	O
cancer	O
,	O
has	O
both	O
estrogen	S-chem
agonist	O
and	O
antagonist	O
actions	O
.	O

Pure	O
antiestrogens	O
are	O
devoid	O
of	O
any	O
estrogen	S-chem
agonist	O
effects	O
.	O

ICI	B-chem
182,780	E-chem
(	O
fulvestrant	S-chem
)	O
(	O
Faslodex	S-chem
)	O
and	O
ICI	B-chem
164,384	E-chem
are	O
competitive	O
inhibitors	O
of	O
estrogen	S-chem
by	O
binding	O
to	O
the	O
estrogen	S-chem
receptor	O
(	O
ER	O
)	O
.	O

Preclinical	O
and	O
clinical	O
studies	O
show	O
that	O
fulvestrant	S-chem
and	O
ICI	B-chem
164,384	E-chem
are	O
more	O
potent	O
than	O
tamoxifen	S-chem
in	O
inhibiting	O
the	O
growth	O
of	O
breast	O
cancer	O
cells	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
devoid	O
of	O
any	O
estrogen	S-chem
-	O
agonist	O
action	O
on	O
the	O
uterus	O
and	O
vagina	O
but	O
lack	O
the	O
beneficial	O
effects	O
of	O
tamoxifen	S-chem
on	O
the	O
bone	O
and	O
serum	O
lipid	O
profile	O
.	O

Fulvestrant	S-chem
is	O
the	O
first	O
pure	O
antiestrogen	S-chem
to	O
complete	O
phase	O
III	O
clinical	O
trials	O
.	O

Such	O
studies	O
have	O
shown	O
that	O
fulvestrant	S-chem
is	O
at	O
least	O
as	O
good	O
as	O
anastrozole	S-chem
in	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
post	O
-	O
menopausal	O
women	O
with	O
advanced	O
breast	O
cancer	O
who	O
had	O
relapsed	O
or	O

on	O
prior	O

therapy	O
.	O

The	O
drug	O
was	O
well	O

and	O
only	O

side	O
-	O
effects	O
were	O
reported	O
.	O

Its	O

in	O
the	O
adjuvant	O
setting	O
will	O

its	O

on	O
bone	O

EM	B-chem
-	I-chem
800	E-chem
and	O

-	I-chem

are	O

to	O

.	O

Hepatotoxicity	O
of	O

Serotonin	S-chem
transporter	O
polymorphisms	O
and	O

of	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

Considerable	O

that	O

(	O

of	O

of	O

-	O

and	O
44	O

-	O
American	O
controls	O
.	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

.	O

of	O

As	O

A	O
molecular	O
mechanism	O
of	O
action	O
of	O
theophylline	S-chem
:	O

to	O
decrease	O
inflammatory	O
gene	O
expression	O
.	O

The	O
molecular	O
mechanism	O
for	O
the	O
anti	O
-	O
inflammatory	O
action	O
of	O
theophylline	S-chem
is	O
currently	O
unknown	O
,	O
but	O
low	O
-	O
dose	O
theophylline	S-chem
is	O
an	O
effective	O
add	O
-	O
on	O
therapy	O
to	O
corticosteroids	O
in	O
controlling	O
asthma	O
.	O

Corticosteroids	S-chem
act	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
in	O
part	O
,	O
by	O
recruitment	O
of	O
histone	O
deacetylases	O
(	O
HDACs	O
)	O
to	O
the	O
site	O
of	O
active	O
inflammatory	O
gene	O
transcription	O
.	O

They	O
thereby	O
inhibit	O
the	O
acetylation	O
of	O
core	O
histones	O
that	O
is	O
necessary	O
for	O
inflammatory	O
gene	O
transcription	O
.	O

We	O
show	O
both	O
in	O
vitro	O
and	O
in	O
vivo	O
that	O
low	O
-	O
dose	O
theophylline	S-chem
enhances	O

activity	O
in	O
epithelial	O
cells	O
and	O

.	O

This	O

is	O
then	O
available	O
for	O

recruitment	O
and	O
predicts	O
a	O

between	O

and	O
theophylline	S-chem
.	O

This	O

occurs	O
at	O

of	O
theophylline	S-chem
and	O
is	O
dissociated	O
from	O

inhibition	O
(	O
the	O

of	O
bronchodilation	O
)	O
or	O
the	O
blockade	O
of	O
adenosine	S-chem
receptors	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
partially	O
responsible	O
for	O
its	O
side	O
effects	O
.	O

Thus	O
we	O
have	O
shown	O
that	O
low	O
-	O
dose	O
theophylline	S-chem
exerts	O
an	O
anti	O
-	O
asthma	O
effect	O
through	O
increasing	O
activation	O
of	O
HDAC	O
which	O
is	O
subsequently	O
recruited	O
by	O
corticosteroids	S-chem
to	O
suppress	O
inflammatory	O
genes	O
.	O

,	O
3	O
micromol	O
/	O

for	O

,	O

for	O

-	O

and	O

for	O

Rifampicin	S-chem
(	O

and	O
OATP	O
-	O
A	O
-	O

below	O
15	O
%	O
.	O

100	O
micromol	O
/	O

inhibited	O

-	O

and	O

.	O

The	O

(	O

/	O

-	O

Direct	O

of	O

could	O

for	O

-	O

(	O

(	O

/	O
L	O

(	O

/	O

)	O
.	O

In	O

these	O

that	O

and	O

with	O

to	O
different	O
extents	O
.	O

Inhibition	O
of	O
human	O
liver	O
OATPs	O
can	O
explain	O
the	O
previously	O
observed	O
effects	O
of	O
rifamycin	B-chem
SV	E-chem
and	O

on	O
hepatic	O
organic	O
anion	O
elimination	O
.	O

Metformin	S-chem
increases	O
AMP	S-chem
-	O
activated	O
protein	O
kinase	O
activity	O
in	O
skeletal	O
muscle	O
of	O
subjects	O
with	O
type	O
2	O
diabetes	O
.	O

Metformin	S-chem
is	O
an	O
effective	O
hypoglycemic	O
drug	O
that	O
lowers	O
blood	O
glucose	S-chem
concentrations	O
by	O
decreasing	O
hepatic	O
glucose	S-chem
production	O
and	O
increasing	O
glucose	S-chem
disposal	O
in	O
skeletal	O
muscle	O
;	O
however	O
,	O
the	O
molecular	O
site	O
of	O
metformin	S-chem
action	O
is	O
not	O
well	O
understood	O
.	O

AMP	S-chem
-	O
activated	O
protein	O
kinase	O
(	O
AMPK	O
)	O
activity	O
increases	O
in	O
response	O
to	O
depletion	O
of	O
cellular	O
energy	O
stores	O
,	O
and	O
this	O
enzyme	O
has	O
been	O
implicated	O
in	O
the	O
stimulation	O
of	O
glucose	S-chem
uptake	O
into	O
skeletal	O
muscle	O
and	O
the	O
inhibition	O
of	O
liver	O
gluconeogenesis	O
.	O

We	O
recently	O
reported	O
that	O
AMPK	O
is	O
activated	O
by	O
metformin	S-chem
in	O
cultured	O
rat	O
hepatocytes	O
,	O
mediating	O
the	O
inhibitory	O
effects	O
of	O
the	O
drug	O
on	O
hepatic	O
glucose	S-chem
production	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
present	O
study	O
,	O
we	O
evaluated	O
whether	O
therapeutic	O
doses	O
of	O
metformin	S-chem
increase	O
AMPK	O
activity	O
in	O
vivo	O
in	O
subjects	O
with	O
type	O
2	O
diabetes	O
.	O

Metformin	S-chem
treatment	O
for	O
10	O
weeks	O
significantly	O
increased	O
AMPK	O
alpha2	O
activity	O
in	O
the	O
skeletal	O
muscle	O
,	O
and	O
this	O
was	O
associated	O
with	O
increased	O
phosphorylation	O
of	O
AMPK	O
on	O
Thr172	O
and	O
decreased	O
acetyl	B-chem
-	I-chem
CoA	E-chem
carboxylase	O
-	O
2	O
activity	O
.	O

The	O
increase	O
in	O
AMPK	O
alpha2	O
activity	O
was	O
likely	O
due	O
to	O
a	O
change	O
in	O
muscle	O
energy	O
status	O
because	O
ATP	S-chem
and	O
phosphocreatine	S-chem
concentrations	O
were	O
lower	O
after	O
metformin	S-chem
treatment	O
.	O

Metformin	S-chem
-	O
induced	O
increases	O
in	O
AMPK	O
activity	O
were	O
associated	O
with	O
higher	O
rates	O
of	O
glucose	S-chem
disposal	O
and	O
muscle	O
glycogen	O
concentrations	O
.	O

These	O
findings	O
suggest	O
that	O
the	O
metabolic	O
effects	O
of	O
metformin	O
in	O
subjects	O
with	O
type	O
2	O
diabetes	O
may	O
be	O
mediated	O
by	O
the	O
activation	O
of	O
AMPK	O
alpha2	O
.	O

Thalidomide	S-chem
prevents	O
alcoholic	S-chem
liver	O
injury	O
in	O
rats	O
through	O
suppression	O
of	O
Kupffer	O
cell	O
sensitization	O
and	O
TNF	O
-	O
alpha	O
production	O
.	O

BACKGROUND	O
&	O
AIMS	O
:	O
Sensitization	O
of	O
Kupffer	O
cells	O
(	O
KCs	O
)	O
to	O
lipopolysaccharide	O
(	O
LPS	O
)	O
and	O
overproduction	O
of	O
tumor	O
necrosis	O
factor	O
(	O
TNF	O
)	O
alpha	O
are	O
critical	O
for	O
progression	O
of	O
alcoholic	S-chem
liver	O
injury	O
.	O

Thalidomide	S-chem
has	O
been	O
shown	O
to	O
suppress	O
TNF	O
-	O
alpha	O
production	O
from	O
macrophages	O
.	O

Accordingly	O
,	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
this	O
study	O
was	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
thalidomide	S-chem
could	O
prevent	O
alcohol	S-chem
-	O
induced	O
liver	O
injury	O
.	O

METHODS	O
:	O
Rats	O
were	O
given	O
ethanol	S-chem
(	O
5	O
g	O
/	O
kg	O
body	O
wt	O
)	O
and	O
thalidomide	S-chem
(	O
5	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
)	O
once	O
every	O
24	O
hours	O
intragastrically	O
.	O

To	O
assess	O
the	O
sensitization	O
of	O
Kupffer	O
cells	O
,	O
LPS	O
(	O
5	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
intravenously	O
)	O
was	O
administered	O
and	O
liver	O
histology	O
was	O
evaluated	O
24	O
hours	O
later	O
.	O

KCs	O
were	O
isolated	O
after	O
4	O
weeks	O
of	O
ethanol	S-chem
treatment	O
and	O
intracellular	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
(	O
[	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
]	O
i	O
)	O
was	O
measured	O
using	O
fura	O
-	O
2	O
,	O
whereas	O
TNF	O
-	O
alpha	O
was	O
evaluated	O
by	O
reverse	O
-	O
transcription	O
polymerase	O
chain	O
reaction	O
and	O
enzyme	O
-	O
linked	O
immunosorbent	O
assay	O
.	O

CD14	O
was	O
determined	O
by	O
Western	O
and	O
fluorescence	O
staining	O
.	O

RESULTS	O
:	O
Treatment	O
with	O
ethanol	S-chem
for	O
8	O
weeks	O
caused	O
marked	O
steatosis	O
,	O
necrosis	O
,	O
and	O
inflammation	O
in	O
the	O
liver	O
.	O

These	O
pathologic	O
parameters	O
were	O
diminished	O
markedly	O
by	O
treatment	O
with	O
thalidomide	S-chem
.	O

In	O
the	O
4	O
-	O
week	O
ethanol	S-chem
group	O
,	O
the	O
LPS	O
-	O
induced	O
liver	O
damage	O
was	O
aggravated	O
and	O
KCs	O
were	O
sensitized	O
to	O
LPS	O
.	O

Coadministration	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
with	O
ethanol	S-chem
prevented	O
the	O
KC	O
sensitization	O
completely	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
thalidomide	S-chem
abolished	O
the	O
LPS	O
-	O
induced	O
increase	O
in	O
CD14	O
expression	O
and	O
[	O
Ca2	B-chem
+	E-chem
]	O
i	O
elevation	O
in	O
KCs	O
.	O

Gut	O
permeability	O
was	O
increased	O
about	O
10	O
-	O
fold	O
after	O
4	O
weeks	O
of	O
ethanol	S-chem
exposure	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
not	O
affected	O
by	O
thalidomide	S-chem
.	O

Moreover	O
,	O
thalidomide	S-chem
reduced	O
the	O
LPS	O
-	O
induced	O
TNF	O
-	O
alpha	O
production	O
by	O
KCs	O
by	O
decreasing	O
TNF	O
-	O
alpha	O
messenger	O
RNA	O
.	O

CONCLUSIONS	O
:	O
These	O
results	O
collectively	O
indicate	O
that	O
thalidomide	S-chem
prevents	O
alcoholic	O
liver	O
injury	O
through	O
suppression	O
of	O
TNF	O
-	O
alpha	O
production	O
and	O
abolishment	O
of	O
KC	O
sensitization	O
.	O

Identification	O
and	O
characterization	O
of	O
a	O
novel	O
flavin	S-chem
-	O
containing	O
spermine	S-chem
oxidase	O
of	O
mammalian	O
cell	O
origin	O
.	O

During	O
polyamine	S-chem
catabolism	O
,	O
spermine	S-chem
and	O
spermidine	S-chem
are	O
first	O
acetylated	O
by	O
spermidine	S-chem
/	O
spermine	S-chem
N	S-chem
(	O
1	O
)	O
-	O
acetyltransferase	O
(	O
SSAT	O
)	O
and	O
subsequently	O
oxidized	O
by	O
polyamine	S-chem
oxidase	O
(	O
PAO	O
)	O
to	O
produce	O
spermidine	S-chem
and	O
putrescine	S-chem
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

In	O
attempting	O
to	O
clone	O
the	O
PAO	O
involved	O
in	O
this	O
back	O
-	O
conversion	O
pathway	O
,	O
we	O
encountered	O
an	O
oxidase	O
that	O
preferentially	O
cleaves	O
spermine	S-chem
in	O
the	O
absence	O
of	O
prior	O
acetylation	O
by	O
SSAT	O
.	O

A	O
BLAST	O
search	O
using	O
maize	O
PAO	O
sequences	O
identified	O
homologous	O
mammalian	O
cDNAs	O
derived	O
from	O
human	O
hepatoma	O
and	O
mouse	O
mammary	O
carcinoma	O
:	O
the	O
encoded	O
proteins	O
differed	O
by	O
20	O
amino	B-chem
acids	E-chem
.	O

When	O
either	O
cDNA	O
was	O
transiently	O
transfected	O
into	O
HEK	O
-	O
293	O
cells	O
,	O
intracellular	O
spermine	S-chem
pools	O
decreased	O
by	O
75	O
%	O
while	O
spermidine	S-chem
and	O
N	B-chem
(	I-chem
1	I-chem
)	I-chem
-	I-chem
acetylspermidine	E-chem
pools	O
increased	O
,	O
suggesting	O
that	O
spermine	S-chem
was	O
selectively	O
and	O
directly	O
oxidized	O
by	O
the	O
enzyme	O
.	O

Substrate	O
specificity	O
using	O
lysates	O
of	O
oxidase	O
-	O
transfected	O
HEK	O
-	O
293	O
cells	O
revealed	O
that	O
the	O
newly	O
identified	O
oxidase	O
strongly	O
favoured	O
spermine	S-chem
over	O
N	B-chem
(	I-chem
1	I-chem
)	I-chem
-	I-chem
acetylspermine	E-chem
and	O
that	O
it	O
failed	O
to	O
act	O
on	O
N	B-chem
(	I-chem
1	I-chem
)	I-chem
-	I-chem
acetylspermidine	E-chem
,	O
spermidine	S-chem
or	O
the	O
preferred	O
PAO	O
substrate	O
,	O
N	B-chem
(	I-chem
1	I-chem
)	I-chem
,	I-chem
N	I-chem
(	I-chem
12	I-chem
)	I-chem
-	I-chem
diacetylspermine	E-chem
.	O

The	O
PAO	O
inhibitor	O
,	O
MDL	B-chem
-	I-chem
72,527	E-chem
,	O
only	O
partially	O
blocked	O
oxidation	O
of	O
spermine	S-chem
while	O
a	O
previously	O
reported	O
PAO	O
substrate	O
,	O
N	B-chem
(	I-chem
1	I-chem
)	I-chem
-	I-chem
(	I-chem
n	I-chem
-	I-chem
octanesulphonyl	I-chem
)	I-chem
spermine	E-chem
,	O
potently	O
inhibited	O
the	O
reaction	O
.	O

Overall	O
,	O
the	O
data	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
enzyme	O
represents	O
a	O
novel	O
mammalian	O
oxidase	O
which	O
,	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
substrate	O
specificity	O
,	O
we	O
have	O
designated	O
spermine	S-chem
oxidase	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
distinguish	O
it	O
from	O
the	O
PAO	O
involved	O
in	O
polyamine	S-chem
back	O
-	O
conversion	O
.	O

The	O
identification	O
of	O
an	O
enzyme	O
capable	O
of	O
directly	O
oxidizing	O
spermine	S-chem
to	O
spermidine	S-chem
has	O
important	O
implications	O
for	O
understanding	O
polyamine	O
homoeostasis	O
and	O
for	O
interpreting	O
metabolic	O
and	O
cellular	O
responses	O
to	O
clinically	O
relevant	O
polyamine	S-chem
analogues	O
and	O
inhibitors	O
.	O

Low	O
incidence	O
of	O
paradoxical	O
platelet	O
activation	O
by	O
glycoprotein	O
IIb	O
/	O
IIIa	O
inhibitors	O
.	O

The	O
human	O
platelet	O
antigen	O
-	O
1	O
(	O
HPA	O
-	O
1	O
,	O
Pl	O
(	O
A	O
)	O
)	O
polymorphism	O
has	O
been	O
proposed	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
inhibitory	O
actions	O
of	O
abciximab	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
we	O
hypothesized	O
that	O
this	O
polymorphism	O
might	O
also	O
be	O
the	O
cause	O
for	O
paradoxical	O
activation	O
of	O
platelets	O
by	O
GPIIb	O
/	O
IIIa	O
inhibitors	O
.	O

The	O
effects	O
of	O
abciximab	O
(	O
1	O
-	O
10	O
microg	O
/	O
ml	O
)	O
,	O
tirofiban	S-chem
(	O
3	O
-	O
30	O
nM	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
eptifibatide	S-chem
(	O
0.3	O
-	O
3	O
microg	O
/	O
ml	O
)	O
on	O
basal	O
and	O
ADP	S-chem
(	O
3	O
microM	O
)	O
-	O
induced	O
CD62P	O
externalization	O
were	O
measured	O
in	O
n	O
=	O
62	O
healthy	O
blood	O
donors	O
and	O
n	O
=	O
177	O
patients	O
with	O
stable	O
coronary	O
artery	O
disease	O
.	O

All	O
subjects	O
were	O
genotyped	O
for	O
the	O
human	O
platelet	O
antigen	O
-	O
1	O
(	O
HPA	O
-	O
1	O
,	O
Pl	O
(	O
A	O
)	O
)	O
polymorphism	O
by	O
GALIOS	O
(	O
R	O
)	O
and	O
fluorescence	O
correlation	O
spectroscopy	O
.	O

Although	O
a	O
significant	O
platelet	O
hyperreactivity	O
was	O
observed	O
in	O
the	O
patients	O
,	O
the	O
HPA	O
-	O
1	O
genotype	O
did	O
not	O
influence	O
basal	O
or	O
ADP	S-chem
-	O
induced	O
CD62P	O
expression	O
.	O

A	O
moderate	O
(	O
twofold	O
)	O
stimulation	O
of	O

expression	O
by	O
abciximab	O
but	O
not	O
by	O
tirofiban	S-chem
or	O
eptifibatide	S-chem
was	O
observed	O
in	O
one	O
patient	O
.	O

Interestingly	O
,	O
this	O
patient	O
carried	O
the	O
HPA	O
-	O
1	O
b	O
/	O
b	O
genotype	O
.	O

In	O
no	O
other	O
subject	O
any	O
activation	O
of	O
platelets	O
by	O
GP	O
IIb	O
/	O
IIIa	O
inhibitors	O
was	O
observed	O
and	O
there	O
were	O
no	O

differences	O
between	O
HPA	O
-	O
1	O
genotypes	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
GP	O
IIb	O
/	O
IIIa	O
inhibitors	O
on	O
basal	O
or	O
ADP	S-chem
-	O
stimulated	O
CD62P	O
expression	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
concluded	O
that	O
paradoxical	O
platelet	O
activation	O
by	O
abciximab	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
(	O
<	O
2	O
%	O
)	O
phenomenon	O
.	O

HPA	O
-	O
1	O
b	O
/	O
b	O
genotype	O
might	O

factor	O
(	O

)	O

of	O

Pharmacodynamics	O

.	O

Phenylbutazone	S-chem
(	O

)	O

to	O

(	O

.	O

The	O
development	O
of	O
estrogen	S-chem
-	O
induced	O

in	O
Fischer	O
344	O
(	O

)	O
rats	O
is	O

with	O
enhanced	O

.	O

This	O
type	O
of	O

is	O
a	O

Pentosan	O

(	O

of	O

.	O

We	O
have	O

the	O

of	O

on	O
tumor	O
growth	O
,	O
hyperprolactinemia	O
and	O

in	O
diethylstilbestrol	S-chem
-	O
induced	O
anterior	O
pituitary	O

in	O
F344	O
rats	O
.	O

.	O

The	O

of	O

identified	O
by	O

-	O

also	O
not	O

by	O

drug	O
.	O

On	O
the	O

hand	O
,	O

has	O
been	O

to	O
decrease	O
cell	O

evaluated	O
by	O
a	O

of	O

-	O

.	O

Moreover	O
,	O
the	O
TUNEL	O
method	O
has	O

of	O

bodies	O

the	O

after	O

with	O

.	O

This	O

of	O

in	O
this	O
experimental	O
design	O
.	O

Localization	O
of	O
the	O
ammonium	S-chem
transporter	O
proteins	O
RhBG	O
and	O
RhCG	O
in	O
mouse	O
kidney	O
.	O

Ammonia	S-chem
is	O
both	O
produced	O
and	O
transported	O
by	O
renal	O
epithelial	O
cells	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
regulates	O
renal	O
ion	O
transport	O
.	O

Recent	O
studies	O
have	O
identified	O
a	O
family	O
of	O
putative	O
ammonium	S-chem
transporters	O
;	O
mRNA	O
for	O
two	O
members	O
of	O
this	O
family	O
,	O
Rh	O
B	O
-	O
glycoprotein	O
(	O
RhBG	O
)	O
and	O
Rh	O
C	O
-	O
glycoprotein	O
(	O
RhCG	O
)	O
,	O
is	O
expressed	O
in	O
the	O
kidney	O
.	O

The	O
purpose	O
of	O
this	O
study	O
was	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
cellular	O
location	O
of	O
RhBG	O
and	O
RhCG	O
protein	O
in	O
the	O
mouse	O
kidney	O
.	O

We	O
generated	O
RhBG	O
-	O
and	O
RhCG	O
-	O
specific	O
anti	O
-	O
peptide	O
antibodies	O
.	O

Immunoblot	O

Phosphodiesterase	O
type	O
5	O
as	O
a	O

target	O
in	O

dysfunction	O
.	O

The	O

of	O
pharmacologically	O
inhibiting	O
phosphodiesterase	O
type	O
5	O
(	O
PDE5	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
erectile	O
dysfunction	O
(	O
ED	O
)	O
is	O
reviewed	O
.	O

Published	O
literature	O
on	O
the	O
nitric	B-chem
oxide	E-chem
-	O
cyclic	B-chem
guanosine	I-chem
monophosphate	E-chem
(	O
cGMP	S-chem
)	O
pathway	O
for	O
penile	O
erection	O
and	O
on	O
PDE5	O
inhibition	O
using	O
sildenafil	O
as	O
the	O
model	O
for	O
pharmacologic	O
PDE5	O
inhibition	O
are	O
assessed	O
.	O

The	O
key	O

in	O
the	O
mediation	O
of	O
penile	O
erection	O
is	O
cGMP	O
.	O

PDE5	O
is	O
the	O
predominant	O

in	O
the	O
corpus	O
cavernosum	O
,	O
and	O
cGMP	S-chem
is	O
its	O
primary	O
substrate	O
.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
in	O
men	O
with	O
ED	O
,	O
elevation	O
of	O
cGMP	S-chem
in	O
corpus	O

tissue	O
via	O
selective	O

of	O
cGMP	S-chem
-	O
specific	O

is	O
a	O
means	O
of	O
improving	O
erectile	O
function	O
at	O
minimal	O
risk	O
of	O
adverse	O
events	O
.	O

This	O
approach	O
is	O
validated	O
by	O
the	O
clinical	O
efficacy	O
and	O
safety	O
of	O
sildenafil	S-chem
,	O
the	O

drug	O
for	O
selective	O
PDE5	O
inhibitor	O
therapy	O
for	O
ED	O
.	O

Sildenafil	S-chem
exhibits	O
inhibitory	O
potency	O
against	O
PDE5	O
and	O
a	O
10	O
-	O
fold	O
lower	O
dose	O
-	O
related	O
inhibitory	O
potency	O
against	O
rod	O
outer	O
segment	O
PDE6	O
,	O
the	O
predominant	O
PDE	O
in	O
the	O
phototransduction	O
cascade	O
in	O
rods	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
its	O

profile	O
is	O
predictable	O
,	O
with	O
close	O

between	O

and	O

properties	O
.	O

a	O

of	O
men	O

.	O

all	O

.	O

induction	O
of	O
HSPs	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
prevented	O
by	O
1	O
micro	O
g	O
/	O
mL	O
cycloheximide	S-chem
(	O

)	O
.	O

H2O2	S-chem
caused	O
cell	O
loss	O
and	O
increased	O

features	O
of	O
apoptosis	O

-	O
mediated	O
dUTP	O
nick	O
-	O

(	O

)	O

-	O

Investigation	O
of	O
bradykinin	S-chem

in	O

and	O

inhibitors	O
GW660511X	S-chem
and	O
omapatrilat	S-chem
.	O

Activity	O
of	O
opioid	O
ligands	O
in	O

.	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
The	O
aim	O
of	O
the	O
present	O
study	O
was	O
to	O
describe	O
the	O
activity	O
of	O
a	O
set	O
of	O
opioid	O
drugs	O
,	O
including	O
partial	O
agonists	O
,	O
in	O
a	O
cell	O
system	O
expressing	O
only	O
mu	O
opioid	O
receptors	O
.	O

Receptor	O
activation	O
was	O
assessed	O
by	O
measuring	O
the	O
inhibition	O
of	O
forskolin	S-chem
-	O
stimulated	O
cyclic	B-chem
adenosine	I-chem
mono	I-chem
phosphate	E-chem
(	O
cAMP	S-chem
)	O
production	O
.	O

Efficacies	O
and	O
potencies	O
of	O
these	O
ligands	O
were	O
determined	O
relative	O
to	O
the	O
endogenous	O
ligand	O
beta	O
-	O
endorphin	O
and	O
the	O
common	O
mu	O
agonist	O
,	O
morphine	S-chem
.	O

RESULTS	O
:	O
Among	O
the	O
ligands	O
studied	O
naltrexone	S-chem
,	O
WIN	B-chem
44,441	E-chem
and	O
SKF	B-chem
10047	E-chem
,	O
were	O
classified	O
as	O
antagonists	O
,	O
while	O
the	O
remaining	O
ligands	O
were	O
agonists	O
.	O

Agonist	O
efficacy	O
was	O
assessed	O
by	O
determining	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
inhibition	O
of	O
forskolin	S-chem
-	O
stimulated	O
cAMP	S-chem
production	O
.	O

The	O
rank	O
order	O
of	O
efficacy	O
of	O
the	O
agonists	O
was	O
fentanyl	S-chem
=	O
hydromorphone	S-chem
=	O
beta	O
-	O
endorphin	O
>	O
etorphine	S-chem
=	O
lofentanil	S-chem
=	O
butorphanol	S-chem
=	O
morphine	S-chem
=	O
nalbuphine	S-chem
=	O
nalorphine	S-chem
>	O
cyclazocine	S-chem
=	O
dezocine	S-chem
=	O
metazocine	S-chem
>	O
or	O
=	O
xorphanol	S-chem
.	O

The	O
rank	O
order	O
of	O
potency	O
of	O
these	O
ligands	O
was	O
different	O
from	O
that	O
of	O
their	O
efficacies	O
;	O
etorphine	S-chem
>	O
hydromorphone	S-chem
>	O
dezocine	S-chem
>	O
xorphanol	S-chem
=	O
nalorphine	S-chem
=	O
butorphanol	S-chem
=	O
lofentanil	S-chem
>	O
metazocine	S-chem
>	O
nalbuphine	S-chem
>	O
cyclazocine	S-chem
>	O
fentanyl	S-chem
>	O
morphine	S-chem
>	O
>	O
>	O
>	O
beta	O
-	O
endorphin	O
.	O

CONCLUSION	O
:	O
These	O
results	O
elucidate	O
the	O
relative	O
activities	O
of	O
a	O
set	O
of	O
opioid	O
ligands	O
at	O
mu	O
opioid	O
receptor	O
and	O
can	O
serve	O
as	O
the	O
initial	O
step	O
in	O
a	O
systematic	O
study	O
leading	O
to	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
mode	O
of	O
action	O
of	O
opioid	O
ligands	O
at	O
this	O
receptor	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
these	O
results	O
can	O
assist	O
in	O
understanding	O
the	O
physiological	O
effect	O
of	O
many	O
opioid	O
ligands	O
acting	O
through	O
mu	O
opioid	O
receptors	O
.	O

Ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
in	O
a	O
canine	O
model	O
of	O
LQT3	O
:	O
arrhythmogenic	O
effects	O
of	O
sympathetic	O
activity	O
and	O
therapeutic	O
effects	O
of	O
mexiletine	S-chem
.	O

The	O
ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
LQT3	O
syndrome	O
are	O
typically	O
bradycardia	O
-	O
dependent	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
some	O
episodes	O
can	O
be	O
associated	O
with	O
exercise	O
or	O
emotional	O
stress	O
,	O
suggesting	O
a	O
different	O
arrhythmogenic	O
mechanism	O
when	O
sympathetic	O
activity	O
predominates	O
.	O

This	O
study	O
examined	O
the	O
potential	O
arrhythmogenic	O
mechanisms	O
during	O
periods	O
of	O
autonomically	O
mediated	O
transient	O
heart	O
rate	O
acceleration	O
in	O
a	O
canine	O
anthopleurin	O
-	O
A	O
model	O
of	O
LQT3	O
syndrome	O
.	O

Using	O
plunge	O
needle	O
electrodes	O
,	O
transmural	O
unipolar	O
electrograms	O
of	O
the	O
left	O
ventricle	O
were	O
recorded	O
from	O
endocardial	O
(	O
Endo	O
)	O
,	O
mid	O
-	O
myocardial	O
(	O
Mid	O
)	O
and	O
epicardial	O
(	O
Epi	O
)	O
sites	O
.	O

The	O
activation	O
-	O
recovery	O
interval	O
(	O
ARI	O
)	O
was	O
measured	O
to	O
estimate	O
local	O
refractoriness	O
.	O

The	O
cardiac	O
cycle	O
length	O
was	O
gradually	O
shortened	O
by	O
cessation	O
of	O
vagal	O
stimulation	O
(	O
vagal	O
stimulation	O
protocol	O
(	O
VSP	O
)	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
intramural	O
electrograms	O
and	O
onset	O
mode	O
of	O
ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
were	O
analyzed	O
in	O
7	O
experiments	O
.	O

The	O
VSP	O
was	O
performed	O
8	O
times	O
before	O
and	O
5	O
times	O
after	O
administration	O
of	O
mexiletine	S-chem
in	O
each	O
experiment	O
.	O

Before	O
mexiletine	S-chem
,	O
vagal	O
stimulation	O
slowed	O
the	O
heart	O
rate	O
and	O
created	O
large	O
transmural	O
ARI	O
dispersion	O
because	O
of	O
a	O
greater	O
ARI	O
prolongation	O
at	O
Mid	O
rather	O
than	O
Epi	O
/	O
Endo	O
sites	O
.	O

After	O
cessation	O
of	O
vagal	O
stimulation	O
,	O
unipolar	O
electrograms	O
started	O
to	O
show	O
ARI	O
alternans	O
and	O
ventricular	O
premature	O
beats	O
developed	O
sporadically	O
.	O

Sustained	O
ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
were	O
induced	O
in	O
12	O
of	O
the	O
56	O
trials	O
of	O
the	O
VSP	O
.	O

Initiation	O
of	O
ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
was	O
associated	O
with	O
delayed	O
conduction	O
at	O
Mid	O
/	O
Endo	O
sites	O
.	O

Mexiletine	S-chem
attenuated	O
transmural	O
ARI	O
dispersion	O
,	O
and	O
neither	O
ARI	O
alternans	O
nor	O
ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
was	O
observed	O
during	O
all	O
35	O
trials	O
of	O
the	O
VSP	O
after	O
mexiletine	S-chem
administration	O
.	O

Heart	O
rate	O
acceleration	O
induced	O
by	O
an	O
abrupt	O
shift	O
to	O
a	O
state	O
of	O
predominant	O
sympathetic	O
activity	O
enhances	O
arrhythmias	O
in	O
this	O
LQT3	O
model	O
.	O

Mexiletine	S-chem
homogenizes	O
ventricular	O
repolarization	O
,	O
suppresses	O
premature	O
complexes	O
and	O
was	O
antiarrhythmic	O
during	O
ventricular	O
tachyarrhythmias	O
induced	O
by	O
the	O
VSP	O
.	O

Butyrylcholinesterase	O
:	O
an	O
important	O
new	O
target	O
in	O
Alzheimer	O
's	O
disease	O
therapy	O
.	O

Acetylcholinesterase	O
(	O
AChE	O
)	O
predominates	O
in	O
the	O
healthy	O
brain	O
,	O
with	O
butyrylcholinesterase	O
(	O
BuChE	O
)	O
considered	O
to	O
play	O
a	O
minor	O
role	O
in	O
regulating	O
brain	O
acetylcholine	S-chem
(	O
ACh	S-chem
)	O
levels	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
BuChE	O
activity	O
progressively	O
increases	O
in	O
patients	O
with	O
Alzheimer	O
's	O
disease	O
(	O
AD	O
)	O
,	O
while	O
AChE	O
activity	O
remains	O
unchanged	O
or	O
declines	O
.	O

Both	O
enzymes	O
therefore	O
represent	O
legitimate	O
therapeutic	O
targets	O
for	O
ameliorating	O
the	O
cholinergic	O
deficit	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
declines	O
in	O
cognitive	O
,	O
behavioral	O
and	O
global	O
functioning	O
characteristic	O
of	O
AD	O
.	O

The	O
two	O
enzymes	O
differ	O
in	O
substrate	O
specificity	O
,	O
kinetics	O
and	O
activity	O
in	O
different	O
brain	O
regions	O
.	O

Experimental	O
evidence	O
from	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
agents	O
with	O
enhanced	O
selectivity	O
for	O

(	O

-	I-chem
8622	E-chem

.	O

A	O

,	O
using	O
eicosapentaenoic	B-chem
acid	E-chem

.	O

cell	O

is	O
a	O

-	O

(	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
In	O
a	O
proliferating	O
tumor	O
,	O
locally	O
secreted	O
polypeptide	O
growth	O
factors	O
,	O
which	O
have	O
autocrine	O
and	O

functions	O
,	O
induce	O
vascularization	O
essential	O
for	O
tumor	O
growth	O
and	O

.	O

These	O
growth	O
factors	O
may	O
serve	O
as	O
targets	O
for	O
tumor	O
therapy	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
shown	O
that	O
the	O
heparinoid	O

(	O

)	O
can	O
block	O

of	O

in	O

and	O

induced	O
by	O
the	O
heparin	O
-	O
binding	O
,	O
Kaposi	O
's	O
sarcoma	O
-	O
derived	O
fibroblast	O
growth	O
factor	O
(	O
K	O
-	O
FGF	O
)	O
.	O

PURPOSE	O
:	O
The	O
purpose	O
of	O
this	O
study	O
was	O
to	O

of	O

from	O

cells	O
and	O

promising	O
antitumor	O
effects	O
of	O
PPS	O
extend	O
to	O
other	O
human	O
tumor	O
cell	O
lines	O
.	O

We	O
studied	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
PPS	O
on	O
stimulation	O
by	O
heparin	O
-	O
binding	O
growth	O
factors	O

from	O
seven	O

vitro	O
and	O
on	O

growing	O
from	O
these	O
cell	O

in	O
athymic	O
nude	O
mice	O
.	O

METHODS	O
:	O
Seven	O
human	O
cell	O
lines	O
established	O
from	O
breast	O
,	O
prostate	O
,	O
epidermoid	O
,	O
and	O

and	O

were	O
used	O
in	O
in	O
vivo	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
in	O
vitro	O
studies	O
of	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
PPS	O
.	O

We	O
also	O
studied	O
in	O
vitro	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
PPS	O
on	O
growth	O
factor	O
-	O
induced	O

of	O
normal	O
rat	O

and	O
human	O
adrenal	O

cells	O
.	O

RESULTS	O
:	O
The	O
tumor	O
cell	O
lines	O
released	O
growth	O
factors	O
into	O
their	O
media	O
that	O
stimulated	O
growth	O
of	O
endothelial	O
and	O
epithelial	O
cells	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
fibroblasts	O
.	O

Heparin	O
-	O
affinity	O
chromatography	O
showed	O
that	O
heparin	O
-	O
binding	O
growth	O
factors	O
contributed	O
substantially	O
to	O
this	O
paracrine	O
activity	O
and	O
that	O
PPS	O
inhibited	O
this	O
stimulus	O
.	O

Six	O
of	O
the	O
seven	O
tumor	O
cell	O
lines	O
were	O
resistant	O
to	O
PPS	O
in	O
soft	O
-	O
agar	O
cloning	O
assays	O
and	O
hence	O
did	O
not	O
appear	O
to	O
depend	O
on	O
autocrine	O
stimulation	O
by	O
the	O
heparin	O
-	O
binding	O
growth	O
factors	O
.	O

In	O
contrast	O
to	O
this	O
in	O
vitro	O
resistance	O
,	O
subcutaneous	O
growth	O
of	O
tumors	O
from	O
all	O
cell	O
lines	O
in	O
athymic	O
nude	O
mice	O
was	O
inhibited	O
in	O
a	O
dose	O
-	O
dependent	O
fashion	O
by	O
daily	O
intraperitoneal	O
injections	O
of	O
PPS	O
.	O

CONCLUSIONS	O
:	O
We	O
conclude	O
that	O
heparin	O
-	O
binding	O
growth	O
factors	O
contribute	O
substantially	O
to	O
tumor	O
growth	O
in	O
vivo	O
and	O
that	O
PPS	O
acts	O
by	O
blocking	O
the	O
paracrine	O
effects	O
of	O
heparin	O
-	O
binding	O
growth	O
factors	O
released	O
from	O
the	O
tumor	O
cells	O
.	O

IMPLICATION	O
:	O
PPS	O
could	O
become	O
a	O
novel	O
treatment	O
tool	O
targeting	O
tumor	O
growth	O
factors	O
.	O

Binding	O
and	O
GTPgammaS	S-chem
autoradiographic	O
analysis	O
of	O
preproorphanin	O

peptide	O
products	O
at	O

and	O
opioid	O
receptors	O
.	O

[	B-chem
35S	I-chem
]	I-chem

adult	O

.	O

(	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

Unlike	O

This	O

in	O

.	O

Although	O

that	O

(	O

-	O

[	B-chem
35S	I-chem
]	I-chem
-	I-chem

in	O

the	O
mu	O
opioid	O
receptor	O
.	O

Tethered	O
dimers	O
as	O
NAD	S-chem
synthetase	O
inhibitors	O
with	O
antibacterial	O
activity	O
.	O

The	O
solution	O
-	O
phase	O
parallel	O
synthesis	O
of	O
tethered	O
dimers	O
was	O
employed	O
to	O
identify	O
lead	O
inhibitors	O
of	O
bacterial	O
NAD	S-chem
synthetase	O
.	O

Active	O
dimers	O
contained	O
two	O
aromatic	O
end	O
groups	O
joined	O
by	O
a	O
polymethylene	O
linker	O
,	O
with	O
one	O
end	O
group	O
containing	O
a	O

positive	O
charge	O
.	O

Effective	O
inhibitors	O
of	O
NAD	S-chem
synthetase	O
also	O
inhibited	O
the	O
growth	O
of	O
Gram	O
-	O
positive	O
(	O
but	O
not	O
Gram	O
-	O
negative	O
)	O
bacteria	O
,	O
including	O
antibiotic	O
-	O
resistant	O
strains	O
.	O

The	O
desmethyl	O
precursors	O
of	O
active	O
inhibitors	O
lacked	O
a	O
permanent	O
positive	O
charge	O
and	O
were	O
inactive	O
as	O
either	O
enzyme	O
inhibitors	O
or	O
antibacterial	O
agents	O
.	O

Similarly	O
,	O
a	O
close	O
structural	O
analogue	O
of	O
the	O
most	O
active	O
inhibitors	O
contained	O
two	O
additional	O
ether	O
oxygens	S-chem
in	O
the	O
tether	O
and	O
was	O
inactive	O
in	O
both	O
assays	O
.	O

These	O
results	O
are	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
premise	O
that	O
NAD	S-chem

inhibition	O
is	O

for	O
the	O
antibacterial	O
actions	O
and	O
support	O
further	O
studies	O
on	O
NAD	S-chem
synthetase	O
as	O
a	O
new	O
target	O
for	O
antibacterial	O
agents	O
.	O

Blockade	O
of	O
LTC4	S-chem
synthesis	O
caused	O
by	O
additive	O
inhibition	O
of	O
gIV	O
-	O
PLA2	O
phosphorylation	O
:	O
Effect	O
of	O
salmeterol	S-chem
and	O
PDE4	S-chem
inhibition	O
in	O
human	O
eosinophils	O
.	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
Prior	O
investigations	O
have	O
demonstrated	O
that	O
beta	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
-	O
adrenoceptor	O
stimulation	O
is	O
ineffective	O
in	O
inhibiting	O
synthesis	O
of	O
eicosanoids	O
in	O
human	O
eosinophils	O
.	O

This	O
effect	O
has	O
been	O
postulated	O
to	O
relate	O
to	O
density	O
or	O
structural	O
differences	O
in	O
the	O
beta	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
-	O
adrenoceptor	O
or	O
its	O
coupled	O
G	O
-	O
protein	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
recent	O
reports	O
indicate	O
that	O
cAMP	S-chem
-	O
specific	O
PDE4	S-chem
activity	O
in	O
eosinophils	O
is	O
10	O
-	O
fold	O
that	O
of	O
other	O
inflammatory	O
cells	O
.	O

We	O
postulated	O
that	O
selective	O
blockade	O
of	O
PDE4	S-chem
in	O
eosinophils	O
would	O
unmask	O
the	O
inhibitory	O
effect	O
of	O
beta	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
-	O
adrenoceptor	O
stimulation	O
and	O
that	O
this	O
inhibition	O
would	O
result	O
from	O
decreased	O
phosphor	O
-	O
ylation	O
of	O
cytosolic	O
group	O
IV	O
-	O
PLA	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
(	O
gIV	O
-	O
PLA	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
)	O
.	O

OBJECTIVE	O
:	O
To	O

(	O
a	O
)	O

inhibition	O
alone	O

of	O

(	O

)	O
and	O

(	I-chem

)	E-chem
(	O

(	I-chem
4	I-chem
)	E-chem
)	O

by	O

of	O

with	O

-	I-chem

-	I-chem

plus	O

/	O

)	O

METHODS	O
:	O

of	O

(	I-chem
4	I-chem
)	E-chem

-	O

.	O

:	O

of	O

and	O

(	I-chem
4	I-chem
)	E-chem
.	O

to	O

production	O

alone	O

.	O

CONCLUSIONS	O
:	O
Inhibition	O
of	O
PDE4	S-chem
by	O
rolipram	S-chem
unmasks	O
beta	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
-	O

blockade	O
of	O
LTC	B-chem
(	I-chem
4	I-chem
)	E-chem
synthesis	O
caused	O
by	O
FMLP	O
/	O
B	O
.	O

A	O
phase	O
1	O
study	O
of	O
tazarotene	S-chem
in	O
adults	O
with	O
advanced	O
cancer	O
.	O

Tazarotene	S-chem
is	O
an	O
acetylenic	B-chem
retinoid	E-chem
which	O
is	O
metabolised	O
to	O
tazarotenic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
and	O
which	O
binds	O
selectively	O
to	O
the	O
retinoid	S-chem
receptors	O
RARbeta	O
and	O
RARgamma	O
.	O

The	O
safety	O
,	O
toxicity	O
and	O
pharmacokinetics	O
of	O
oral	O
tazarotene	S-chem
were	O
determined	O
over	O
12	O
weeks	O
of	O
treatment	O
in	O
34	O
patients	O
with	O
advanced	O
cancer	O
.	O

Commonly	O
seen	O
toxicities	O
were	O
mucocutaneous	O
symptoms	O
,	O
musculoskeletal	O
pain	O
and	O
headache	O
.	O

Dose	O
-	O
limiting	O
toxicities	O
were	O
hypercalcaemia	O
,	O
hypertriglyceridaemia	O
and	O
musculoskeletal	O
pain	O
.	O

The	O
maximum	O
tolerated	O
dose	O
of	O
tazarotene	S-chem
in	O
this	O
schedule	O
is	O
25.2	O
mg	O
day	O
(	O
-	O
1	O
)	O
.	O

Plasma	O
concentrations	O
of	O
tazarotenic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
were	O
found	O
to	O
peak	O
rapidly	O
within	O
1	O
-	O
3	O
h	O
of	O
dosing	O
and	O
thereafter	O
declined	O
quickly	O
.	O

The	O
C	O
(	O
max	O
)	O
and	O
AUC	O
values	O
on	O
day	O
0	O
,	O
and	O
weeks	O
2	O
and	O
4	O
were	O
similar	O
indicating	O
no	O
drug	O
accumulation	O
.	O

The	O
dose	O
-	O
normalised	O
C	O
(	O
max	O
)	O
and	O
AUC	O
values	O
at	O
different	O
dose	O
levels	O
and	O
different	O
study	O
days	O
appeared	O
to	O
be	O
similar	O
indicating	O
linear	O
pharmacokinetics	O
.	O

No	O
objective	O
responses	O
were	O
seen	O
,	O
although	O
stable	O
disease	O
was	O
seen	O
in	O
six	O
out	O
of	O
eight	O
evaluable	O
patients	O
receiving	O
the	O
three	O
highest	O
dose	O
levels	O
of	O
tazarotene	S-chem
(	O
16.8	O
,	O
25.2	O
or	O
33.4	O
mg	O
day	O
(	O
-	O
1	O
)	O
)	O
.	O

We	O
conclude	O
that	O
oral	O
tazarotene	S-chem
is	O
well	O
tolerated	O
when	O
administered	O
daily	O
for	O
12	O
weeks	O
,	O
has	O
a	O
favourable	O
toxicity	O
profile	O
compared	O
with	O
other	O
retinoids	S-chem
and	O
merits	O
further	O
investigation	O
as	O
an	O
anticancer	O
therapy	O
.	O

Anabolic	O
effects	O
of	O
clenbuterol	S-chem
on	O
skeletal	O
muscle	O
are	O
mediated	O
by	O
beta	O
2	O
-	O
adrenoceptor	O
activation	O
.	O

The	O
potent	O
anabolic	O
effects	O
of	O
the	O
beta	O
2	O
-	O
adrenoceptor	O
agonist	O
clenbuterol	S-chem
on	O
skeletal	O
muscle	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
to	O
be	O
independent	O
of	O
actions	O
on	O
beta	O
-	O
adrenoceptors	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
present	O
study	O
clenbuterol	S-chem
,	O
presented	O
to	O
rats	O
in	O
the	O
diet	O
(	O
4	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
)	O
,	O
caused	O
significant	O
increases	O
in	O
gastrocnemius	O
muscle	O
mass	O
,	O
protein	O
,	O
and	O
RNA	O
content	O
and	O
a	O
decrease	O
in	O
epididymal	O
fat	O
pad	O
mass	O
.	O

These	O
effects	O
were	O
not	O
mimicked	O
by	O
oral	O
administration	O
of	O
the	O
beta	O
2	O
-	O
adrenoceptor	O
agonist	O
salbutamol	S-chem
even	O
at	O
high	O
dose	O
(	O
52	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
diet	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
clenbuterol	S-chem
were	O
not	O
inhibited	O
by	O
addition	O
of	O
DL	B-chem
-	I-chem
propranolol	E-chem
(	O
200	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
diet	O
)	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
selective	O
beta	O
2	O
-	O
antagonist	O
ICI	B-chem
-	I-chem
118,551	E-chem
(	O
200	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
diet	O
)	O
reversed	O
the	O
anabolic	O
effects	O
of	O
clenbuterol	S-chem
,	O
and	O
a	O
high	O
dose	O
of	O
DL	B-chem
-	I-chem
propranolol	E-chem
(	O

mg	O
/	O

.	O

Crystal	O
structure	O
of	O
serine	S-chem
dehydratase	O
from	O
rat	O
liver	O
.	O

SDH	O
(	O
L	B-chem
-	I-chem
serine	E-chem
dehydratase	O
,	O
EC	O
4.3.1.17	O
)	O
catalyzes	O
the	O
pyridoxal	B-chem
5	I-chem
'	I-chem
-	I-chem
phosphate	E-chem
(	O
PLP	S-chem
)	O
-	O
dependent	O
dehydration	O
of	O
L	B-chem
-	I-chem
serine	E-chem
to	O
yield	O
pyruvate	S-chem
and	O
ammonia	S-chem
.	O

Liver	O
SDH	O
plays	O
an	O
important	O
role	O
in	O
gluconeogenesis	O
.	O

Formation	O
of	O
pyruvate	S-chem
by	O
SDH	O
is	O
a	O
two	O
-	O
step	O
reaction	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
hydroxyl	S-chem
group	O
of	O
serine	S-chem
is	O
cleaved	O
to	O
produce	O
aminoacrylate	S-chem
,	O
and	O
then	O
the	O
aminoacrylate	S-chem
is	O
deaminated	O
by	O
nonenzymatic	O
hydrolysis	O
to	O
produce	O
pyruvate	S-chem
.	O

The	O
crystal	O
structure	O
of	O
rat	O
liver	O
apo	O
-	O
SDH	O
was	O
determined	O
by	O
single	O
isomorphous	O
replacement	O
at	O
2.8	O
A	O
resolution	O
.	O

The	O
holo	O
-	O
SDH	O
crystallized	O
with	O
O	B-chem
-	I-chem
methylserine	E-chem
(	O
OMS	S-chem
)	O
was	O
also	O
determined	O
at	O
2.6	O
A	O
resolution	O
by	O
molecular	O
replacement	O
.	O

SDH	O
is	O
composed	O
of	O
two	O
domains	O
,	O
and	O
each	O
domain	O
has	O
a	O
typical	O
alphabeta	O
-	O
open	O
structure	O
.	O

The	O
active	O
site	O
is	O
located	O
in	O
the	O
cleft	O
between	O
the	O
two	O
domains	O
.	O

The	O
holo	O
-	O
SDH	O
contained	O
PLP	O
-	O
OMS	O
aldimine	S-chem
in	O
the	O
active	O
site	O
,	O
indicating	O
that	O
OMS	S-chem
can	O
form	O
the	O
Schiff	B-chem
base	E-chem
linkage	O
with	O
PLP	S-chem
,	O
but	O
the	O
subsequent	O
dehydration	O
did	O
not	O
occur	O
.	O

Apo	O
-	O
SDH	O
forms	O
a	O
dimer	O
by	O
inserting	O
the	O
small	O
domain	O
into	O
the	O
catalytic	O
cleft	O
of	O
the	O
partner	O
subunit	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
active	O
site	O
is	O
closed	O
.	O

Holo	O
-	O
SDH	O
also	O
forms	O
a	O
dimer	O
by	O
making	O
contacts	O
at	O
the	O
back	O
of	O
the	O
clefts	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
dimerization	O
does	O
not	O
close	O
the	O
catalytic	O
cleft	O
.	O

The	O
phosphate	O
group	O
of	O
PLP	S-chem
is	O
surrounded	O
by	O
a	O
characteristic	O
G	O
-	O
rich	O
sequence	O
(	O
(	O
168	O
)	O
GGGGL	S-chem
(	O
172	O
)	O
)	O
and	O
forms	O
hydrogen	S-chem
bonds	O
with	O
the	O
amide	S-chem
groups	O
of	O
those	O
amino	B-chem
acid	E-chem
residues	O
,	O
suggesting	O
that	O
the	O
phosphate	S-chem
group	O
can	O
be	O
protonated	O
.	O

N	O
(	O
1	O
)	O
of	O
PLP	S-chem
participates	O
in	O
a	O
hydrogen	S-chem
bond	O
with	O
Cys303	O
,	O
and	O
similar	O
hydrogen	S-chem
bonds	O
with	O
N	O
(	O
1	O
)	O

are	O
seen	O
in	O
other	O
beta	O
-	O
elimination	O
enzymes	O
.	O

These	O
hydrogen	S-chem
bonding	O
schemes	O
indicate	O
that	O

(	O

is	O
not	O

and	O

the	O
pyridine	S-chem
ring	O
can	O
not	O
take	O
a	O
quinone	S-chem
-	O
like	O
structure	O
.	O

These	O
characteristics	O
of	O
the	O
bound	O
PLP	S-chem
suggest	O
that	O

catalysis	O
is	O
not	O

by	O
forming	O
the	O
resonance	O
-	O
stabilized	O
structure	O
of	O
the	O
PLP	B-chem
-	I-chem
Ser	I-chem
aldimine	E-chem
as	O
seen	O
in	O
aminotransferases	O
.	O

A	O
possible	O
catalytic	O
mechanism	O
involves	O
the	O
phosphate	S-chem
group	O
,	O
surrounded	O
by	O
the	O
characteristic	O
sequence	O
,	O
acting	O
as	O
a	O

to	O

a	O

to	O
the	O

hydroxyl	S-chem

of	O
serine	S-chem
.	O

Epidermal	O
growth	O
factor	O
receptor	O
autocrine	O
signaling	O
in	O
RIE	O
-	O
1	O
cells	O
transformed	O
by	O
the	O
Ras	O
oncogene	O
enhances	O
radiation	O
resistance	O
.	O

Oncogenic	O
forms	O
of	O
the	O
small	O
GTPase	O
Ras	O
increase	O
the	O
resistance	O
of	O
cells	O
to	O
killing	O
by	O
ionizing	O
radiation	O
(	O

)	O
.	O

for	O

are	O

in	O
radioresistance	O
include	O

mediated	O
by	O
phosphatidylinositol	S-chem
3	O

kinase	O
(	O

-	O
K	O
)	O
and	O
Raf	O
.	O

Nevertheless	O
,	O

-	O
K	O
and	O

are	O
not	O

to	O

that	O

must	O
also	O
contribute	O
.	O

We	O
show	O
here	O
that	O
Ras	O
-	O
driven	O

signaling	O
through	O
the	O

growth	O
factor	O
receptor	O
(	O
EGFR	O
)	O
also	O
contributes	O
to	O
radioresistance	O
in	O
Ras	O
-	O
transformed	O
cells	O
.	O

Conditioned	O
media	O
(	O
CM	O
)	O
collected	O
from	O
RIE	O
-	O
1	O
rat	O
intestinal	O
epithelial	O
cells	O
expressing	O
oncogenic	O
Ras	O
increased	O
the	O
survival	O
of	O
irradiated	O
cells	O
.	O

Ras	O
-	O
CM	O
contains	O
elevated	O
levels	O
of	O
the	O
EGFR	O
ligand	O

growth	O
factor	O
alpha	O
(	O

-	O

)	O

Both	O

of	O

-	O

to	O
increase	O
radioresistance	O
.	O

with	O

/	O

(	O

.	O

-	O
mediated	O
relaxation	O
of	O
rat	O
abdominal	O
aorta	O
smooth	O
muscle	O
.	O

Use	O
of	O
the	O
norepinephrine	S-chem
transporter	O
as	O
a	O
reporter	O
gene	O
for	O
non	O
-	O
invasive	O
imaging	O
of	O
genetically	O
modified	O
cells	O
.	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
The	O
norepinephrine	S-chem
transporter	O
(	O
NET	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
-	O
affinity	O
transporter	O
for	O
catecholamines	S-chem
.	O

Its	O
expression	O
is	O
almost	O
exclusively	O
restricted	O
to	O
the	O
sympathetic	O
nervous	O
system	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
study	O
we	O
evaluated	O
whether	O
the	O
NET	O
can	O
be	O
used	O
as	O
a	O
reporter	O
gene	O
for	O
non	O
-	O
invasive	O
imaging	O
of	O
genetically	O
modified	O
cells	O
with	O
radiolabeled	O
probes	O
.	O

METHODS	O
:	O
Human	O
A431	O
,	O
HT1080	O
and	O
murine	O
CMS	O
-	O
5	O
cells	O
were	O
retrovirally	O
transduced	O
with	O
bovine	O
NET	O
cDNA	O
.	O

Transduced	O
and	O
parental	O
cells	O
were	O
incubated	O
in	O
vitro	O
with	O
[	B-chem
(	I-chem
131	I-chem
)	I-chem
I	I-chem
]	I-chem
meta	I-chem
-	I-chem
iodobenzylguanidine	E-chem
(	O
[	B-chem
(	I-chem
131	I-chem
)	I-chem
I	I-chem
]	I-chem
MIBG	E-chem
)	O
.	O

The	O
specificity	O
of	O
tracer	O
uptake	O
was	O
determined	O
by	O
adding	O
the	O
NET	O
inhibitor	O
imipramine	S-chem
.	O

Rat	O
PC12	O
cells	O
served	O
as	O
positive	O
controls	O
.	O

Parental	O
and	O
A431NET	O
cells	O
were	O
xenotransplanted	O
into	O
nude	O
mice	O
and	O
tumor	O
uptake	O
of	O
[	B-chem
(	I-chem
123	I-chem
)	I-chem
I	I-chem
]	I-chem
MIBG	E-chem
in	O
vivo	O
was	O
determined	O
after	O
tracer	O
administration	O
.	O

RESULTS	O
:	O
In	O
vitro	O
stably	O
transduced	O
cells	O
showed	O
a	O
66	O
-	O
to	O
120	O
-	O
fold	O
higher	O
[	B-chem
(	I-chem
131	I-chem
)	I-chem
I	I-chem
]	I-chem
MIBG	E-chem
uptake	O
than	O
parental	O
cells	O
.	O

Incubation	O
with	O
imipramine	S-chem
reduced	O
[	B-chem
(	I-chem
131	I-chem
)	I-chem
I	I-chem
]	I-chem
MIBG	E-chem
uptake	O
of	O
transduced	O
cells	O
to	O
the	O
level	O
found	O
in	O

.	O

More	O
than	O

of	O

was	O

in	O
all	O

with	O
tracer	O
-	O
free	O
medium	O
.	O

[	B-chem
(	I-chem
131	I-chem
)	I-chem
I	I-chem
]	I-chem
MIBG	E-chem
uptake	O
in	O
PC12	O

,	O
which	O
express	O
the	O

20	O

than	O
in	O

[	B-chem

.	O

of	O

.	O

CONCLUSIONS	O
:	O
Transduction	O
of	O
tumor	O
cells	O
with	O
NET	O
cDNA	O
causes	O
highly	O
specific	O
uptake	O
and	O
significant	O
retention	O
of	O
catecholamine	S-chem
analogs	O
in	O
vitro	O
and	O
in	O
vivo	O
.	O

These	O
characteristics	O
make	O
the	O
NET	O
suitable	O
as	O
a	O
reporter	O
gene	O
for	O
non	O
-	O
invasive	O
monitoring	O
of	O
gene	O
transfer	O
.	O

Comparative	O
pharmacology	O
of	O
human	O
beta	O
-	O
adrenergic	O
receptor	O
subtypes	O
-	O
-	O
characterization	O
of	O
stably	O
transfected	O
receptors	O
in	O
CHO	O
cells	O
.	O

Although	O
many	O
beta1	O
-	O
receptor	O
antagonists	O
and	O
beta2	O
-	O
receptor	O
agonists	O
have	O
been	O
used	O
in	O
pharmacotherapy	O
for	O
many	O
years	O
their	O
pharmacological	O
properties	O
at	O
all	O
three	O
known	O
subtypes	O
of	O
beta	O
-	O
adrenergic	O
receptors	O
are	O
not	O
always	O
well	O
characterized	O
.	O

The	O
aim	O
of	O
this	O
study	O
was	O
,	O
therefore	O
,	O
to	O
provide	O
comparative	O
binding	O
characteristics	O
of	O
agonists	O
(	O
epinephrine	S-chem
,	O
norepinephrine	S-chem
,	O
isoproterenol	S-chem
,	O
fenoterol	S-chem
,	O
salbutamol	S-chem
,	O
salmeterol	S-chem
,	O
terbutalin	S-chem
,	O
formoterol	S-chem
,	O
broxaterol	S-chem
)	O
and	O
antagonists	O
(	O
propranolol	S-chem
,	O
alprenolol	S-chem
,	O
atenolol	S-chem
,	O
metoprolol	S-chem
,	O
bisoprolol	S-chem
,	O
carvedilol	S-chem
,	O
pindolol	S-chem
,	O
BRL	B-chem
37344	E-chem
,	O
CGP	B-chem
20712	E-chem
,	O
SR	B-chem
59230A	E-chem
,	O
CGP	B-chem
12177	E-chem
,	O
ICI	B-chem
118551	E-chem
)	O
at	O
all	O
three	O
subtypes	O
of	O
human	O
beta	O
-	O
adrenergic	O
receptors	O
in	O
an	O
identical	O
cellular	O
background	O
.	O

We	O
generated	O
Chinese	O
hamster	O
ovary	O
(	O
CHO	O
)	O
cells	O
stably	O
expressing	O
the	O
three	O
beta	O
-	O
adrenergic	O
receptor	O
subtypes	O
at	O
comparable	O
levels	O
.	O

We	O
characterized	O
these	O
receptor	O
subtypes	O
and	O
analyzed	O
the	O
affinity	O
of	O
routinely	O
used	O
drugs	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
experimental	O
compounds	O
in	O
competition	O
binding	O
studies	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
non	O
-	O
selective	O
antagonist	O
125I	B-chem
-	I-chem
cyanopindolol	E-chem
as	O
a	O
radioligand	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
we	O
analyzed	O
the	O
beta	O
-	O
receptor	O
-	O
mediated	O
adenylyl	S-chem
cyclase	O
activity	O
in	O
isolated	O
membranes	O
from	O
these	O
cell	O
lines	O
.	O

The	O
results	O
from	O
our	O
experiments	O
show	O
that	O
all	O
compounds	O
exhibit	O
distinct	O
patterns	O
of	O
selectivity	O
and	O
activity	O
at	O
the	O
three	O
beta	O
-	O
receptor	O
subtypes	O
.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
beta2	O
-	O
or	O
beta3	O
-	O
receptor	O
agonists	O
that	O
are	O
inverse	O
agonists	O
at	O
the	O
other	O
subtypes	O
were	O
identified	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
beta1	O
-	O
receptor	O
antagonists	O
with	O
agonistic	O
activity	O
at	O
beta2	O
-	O
and	O
beta3	O
-	O
receptors	O
were	O
found	O
.	O

These	O
specific	O

of	O
agonism	O
,	O

and	O
inverse	O

at	O

may	O

for	O

use	O
of	O
the	O
respective	O
compounds	O
.	O

Ocular	O

FP	O

)	O

acids	I-chem
of	I-chem

,	I-chem

.	O

Loss	O
of	O
beta	O
-	O

response	O
in	O
myocytes	O
overexpressing	O
the	O
Na	B-chem
+	E-chem
/	O

(	I-chem
2	I-chem

)	E-chem
-	O
exchanger	O
.	O

Increased	O
Na	B-chem
+	E-chem
/	O
Ca	B-chem
(	I-chem
2	I-chem
+	I-chem
)	E-chem
-	O
exchanger	O
(	O
NCX	O
)	O

-	O
adrenoceptor	O
(	O

)	O
responses	O
are	O
observed	O
in	O
failing	O
human	O
heart	O
.	O

To	O
determine	O
the	O
possible	O
interaction	O
between	O
these	O
changes	O
,	O
we	O
investigated	O
the	O
effect	O
of	O

on	O

to	O

in	O

rat	O
ventricular	O

.	O

Responses	O
to	O
isoproterenol	S-chem
were	O
largely	O
mediated	O
through	O
the	O
beta1AR	O
in	O
control	O
myocytes	O
.	O

Adenovirally	O
-	O
mediated	O
overexpression	O
of	O
NCX	O
,	O
at	O
levels	O
,	O
which	O
did	O
not	O

of	O
myocytes	O
,	O
markedly	O
depressed	O
the	O
isoproterenol	S-chem
concentration	O
-	O
response	O
curve	O
.	O

Responses	O
to	O
isoproterenol	S-chem
could	O
be	O
restored	O
to	O
normal	O
by	O
beta2AR	O
blockade	O
,	O
suggesting	O
a	O
beta2AR	O
-	O
mediated	O
inhibition	O
of	O
beta1AR	O
signalling	O
.	O

Pertussis	O
toxin	O
normalised	O
isoproterenol	S-chem
responses	O
in	O
NCX	O
cells	O
,	O
indicating	O
that	O
beta2AR	O
effects	O
were	O
mediated	O
by	O
Gi	O
.	O

Negative	O
-	O
inotropic	O
effects	O
of	O
high	O
concentrations	O
of	O
ICI	O
118,551	O
,	O
previously	O
shown	O
to	O
be	O

to	O
beta2AR	O
-	O

coupling	O
,	O
were	O
increased	O
in	O
NCX	O
cells	O
.	O

We	O
conclude	O
that	O
NCX	O
upregulation	O
can	O
markedly	O
alter	O
the	O
consequences	O
of	O
betaAR	O
stimulation	O
and	O
that	O

may	O
contribute	O
to	O
the	O
alterations	O
in	O
betaAR	O
response	O
seen	O
in	O
failing	O
human	O
heart	O
.	O

Manipulation	O
of	O
kinetic	O
profiles	O
in	O
2	B-chem
-	I-chem
aryl	I-chem
propionic	I-chem
acid	E-chem
cyclooxygenase	O
inhibitors	O
.	O

The	O
nonsteroidal	O
anti	O
-	O
inflammatory	O
drugs	O
flurbiprofen	S-chem
and	O
ibuprofen	S-chem
were	O
modified	O
in	O
an	O
attempt	O
to	O
alter	O
the	O
kinetics	O
of	O
inhibitor	O
binding	O
by	O
COX	O
-	O
1	O
.	O

Contrary	O
to	O
prior	O
predictions	O
,	O
a	O
halogen	S-chem
substituent	O
is	O
not	O
sufficient	O
to	O
confer	O
slow	O
tight	O
-	O
binding	O
behavior	O
.	O

Conversion	O
of	O
the	O
carboxylate	S-chem
moiety	O
of	O
flurbiprofen	S-chem
to	O
an	O
ester	S-chem
or	O
amide	S-chem
abolishes	O
slow	O
tight	O
-	O
binding	O
behavior	O
,	O
regardless	O
of	O
halogenation	O
state	O
.	O

of	O

.	O

PURPOSE	O
:	O
Two	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
epidermal	O
growth	O
factor	O
receptor	O
family	O
,	O
EGFR	O
and	O
HER2	O
,	O
have	O
been	O
implicated	O
in	O
radioresistance	O
in	O
breast	O
cancer	O
and	O
other	O
malignancies	O
.	O

To	O
gauge	O

of	O
targeting	O
both	O
EGFR	O
and	O

human	O

we	O
examined	O
the	O

of	O
a	O

/	O

inhibitor	O
,	O
GW572016	S-chem
,	O
on	O
the	O
proliferation	O
and	O
radiation	O

of	O
either	O
EGFR	O
-	O
or	O
HER2	O
-	O
overexpressing	O
human	O
breast	O
cancer	O
cell	O

.	O

AND	O

:	O

:	O

Irbesartan	S-chem
is	O
a	O
long	O
-	O
acting	O
angiotensin	B-chem
II	E-chem
antagonist	O
acting	O
specifically	O
at	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
the	O
Type	O
1	O
-	O
receptor	O
subtype	O
(	O
AT1	O
-	O
receptor	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
compound	O
lowers	O
blood	O
pressure	O
dose	O
-	O
dependently	O
in	O
hypertensive	O
patients	O
and	O
has	O
a	O
placebo	O
-	O
like	O
tolerability	O
.	O

The	O
antihypertensive	O
efficacy	O
of	O
irbesartan	S-chem
is	O
greatly	O
enhanced	O
by	O
the	O
coadministration	O
of	O
a	O
diuretic	O
,	O
and	O
fixed	O
-	O
dose	O

of	O
irbesartan	S-chem
and	O
hydrochlorothiazide	S-chem
are	O
now	O
available	O
.	O

Irbesartan	S-chem

based	O
treatment	O
appears	O
especially	O
effective	O
for	O
high	O
-	O
risk	O
patients	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
those	O
with	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

.	O

Imiquimod	S-chem
(	O
IMQ	S-chem
)	O
,	O
an	O

of	O
Toll	O
-	O
like	O
receptor	O
-	O

(	O

-	O
7	O

by	O

Physiologically	O

the	O

is	O
using	O
perforin	O
-	O
containing	O

of	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

and	O

in	O

.	O

Caffeine	S-chem
as	O
a	O
psychomotor	O
stimulant	O
:	O
mechanism	O
of	O
action	O
.	O

The	O
popularity	O
of	O
caffeine	S-chem
as	O
a	O
psychoactive	O
drug	O
is	O
due	O
to	O
its	O
stimulant	O
properties	O
,	O
which	O
depend	O
on	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
reduce	O
adenosine	S-chem
transmission	O
in	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

Adenosine	S-chem
A	O
(	O
1	O
)	O
and	O
A	O
(	O
2A	O
)	O
receptors	O
are	O
expressed	O
in	O
the	O
basal	O
ganglia	O
,	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
structures	O
involved	O
in	O
various	O
aspects	O
of	O
motor	O
control	O
.	O

Caffeine	S-chem
acts	O
as	O
an	O
antagonist	O
to	O
both	O
types	O
of	O
receptors	O
.	O

Increasing	O

indicates	O
that	O

effect	O
of	O

is	O

by	O

a	O

of	O

in	O

,	O
the	O
main	O

area	O
of	O
the	O
basal	O
ganglia	O
.	O

These	O
cells	O
express	O
high	O
levels	O
of	O
adenosine	S-chem
A	O
(	O
2A	O
)	O
receptors	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
involved	O
in	O
various	O

processes	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
expression	O
of	O
immediate	O

genes	O
and	O
regulation	O
of	O
the	O
dopamine	S-chem
-	O
and	O
cyclic	B-chem

-	O
regulated	O
32	O
-	O
kDa	O
phosphoprotein	O

-	O
32	O
.	O

on	O

of	O

.	O

Auranofin	S-chem
increases	O
apoptosis	O
and	O
ischaemia	O
-	O
reperfusion	O
injury	O
in	O
the	O
rat	O
isolated	O
heart	O
.	O

Auranofin	S-chem
,	O
an	O
antirheumatic	O
gold	O
compound	O
,	O
is	O
an	O
inhibitor	O
of	O
selenocysteine	S-chem
enzymes	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
thioredoxin	O
reductase	O
and	O
glutathione	S-chem
peroxidase	O
.	O

These	O
enzymes	O
play	O
an	O
important	O
role	O
in	O
protecting	O
cardiac	O
tissue	O
from	O
oxidative	O
stress	O
generated	O
during	O
ischaemia	O
-	O
reperfusion	O
.	O

Auranofin	S-chem
(	O
100	O
mg	O
/	O
kg	O
)	O
was	O
administered	O
to	O
rats	O
and	O
their	O
hearts	O
were	O
subjected	O
to	O
an	O
in	O
vitro	O
model	O
of	O
ischaemia	O
-	O
reperfusion	O
.	O

The	O
activity	O
of	O
thioredoxin	O
reductase	O
and	O
glutathione	S-chem
peroxidase	O
was	O
determined	O
in	O
liver	O
and	O
heart	O
tissues	O
in	O
an	O
attempt	O
to	O
correlate	O
enzymatic	O
activity	O
with	O
heart	O
recovery	O
after	O
ischaemia	O
-	O
reperfusion	O
.	O

There	O
was	O
significantly	O
less	O
thioredoxin	O
reductase	O
activity	O
in	O
rat	O
liver	O
extracts	O
,	O
whereas	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
glutathione	S-chem
activity	O
remained	O
unchanged	O
,	O
demonstrating	O
that	O
the	O
dose	O
of	O
auranofin	S-chem
used	O
was	O
able	O
to	O
selectively	O
inhibit	O
one	O
of	O
these	O
enzyme	O
systems	O
.	O

Rats	O
administered	O
auranofin	S-chem
displayed	O
significantly	O
impaired	O
recovery	O
from	O
ischaemic	O
insult	O
.	O

The	O
end	O
diastolic	O
pressure	O
was	O
increased	O
,	O
whereas	O
the	O
rate	O
pressure	O
product	O
was	O
significantly	O
decreased	O
.	O

The	O
level	O
of	O
postischaemic	O
apoptosis	O
was	O
also	O
assessed	O
by	O
examining	O
caspase	O
-	O
3	O
activity	O
in	O
tissue	O
homogenates	O
.	O

Auranofin	S-chem
significantly	O
increased	O
the	O
degree	O
of	O
postischaemic	O
apoptosis	O
,	O
leading	O
to	O
poor	O
postischaemic	O
recovery	O
.	O

Gallium	S-chem
and	O
other	O
main	O
group	O
metal	O
compounds	O
as	O
antitumor	O
agents	O
.	O

Gallium	S-chem
has	O
been	O
the	O
second	O
metal	O
to	O
show	O
activity	O
against	O
malignant	O
tumors	O
in	O
humans	O
soon	O
after	O
the	O
establishment	O
of	O
platinum	S-chem
drugs	O
in	O
routine	O
clinical	O
practice	O
.	O

It	O
has	O
the	O
unique	O
property	O
of	O
inhibiting	O
tumor	O
growth	O
as	O
a	O
simple	O
cation	O
,	O
mainly	O
because	O
of	O
its	O
close	O
resemblance	O
to	O
ferric	B-chem
iron	E-chem
.	O

Even	O
though	O
its	O
inability	O
to	O
shift	O
between	O
the	O
trivalent	O
and	O
a	O
divalent	O
oxidation	O
state	O
precludes	O
that	O
gallium	S-chem
behaves	O
as	O
an	O
iron	S-chem
analogue	O
in	O
every	O
respect	O
,	O
it	O
strongly	O
interferes	O
with	O
cellular	O
acquisition	O
of	O
iron	O
from	O
blood	O
by	O
competitive	O
interaction	O
with	O
transferrin	O
and	O
transferrin	O
receptor	O
-	O
mediated	O
endocytosis	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
gallium	S-chem
also	O
seems	O
to	O
affect	O
intracellular	O
availability	O
of	O
iron	S-chem
already	O
taken	O
up	O
via	O
this	O
pathway	O
,	O
probably	O
due	O
to	O
its	O
inhibitory	O
activity	O
on	O
vacuolar	O
-	O
type	O
H	B-chem
(	I-chem
+	I-chem
)	E-chem
-	O
ATPases	O
.	O

Apart	O
from	O
the	O
consequences	O
of	O
iron	S-chem
deprivation	O
,	O
gallium	S-chem
exerts	O
cytotoxic	O
effects	O
by	O
direct	O
interaction	O
with	O
the	O
iron	S-chem
-	O
dependent	O
enzyme	O
ribonucleotide	S-chem
reductase	O
,	O
resulting	O
in	O
reduced	O
dNTP	O
pools	O
and	O
inhibition	O
of	O
DNA	O
synthesis	O
.	O

Both	O
the	O
abundance	O
of	O
transferrin	O
receptors	O
and	O
upregulation	O
of	O
ribonucleotide	S-chem
reductase	O
render	O
tumors	O
susceptible	O
to	O
gallium	S-chem
-	O
induced	O
cytotoxicity	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
some	O
experimental	O
findings	O
raise	O
the	O
question	O
whether	O
these	O
effects	O
resulting	O
from	O
the	O
iron	S-chem
-	O
mimicking	O
properties	O
of	O
gallium	S-chem
are	O
solely	O
responsible	O
for	O
its	O
antineoplastic	O
activity	O
or	O
whether	O
additional	O
mechanisms	O
are	O
involved	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
antimitotic	O
effects	O
which	O
result	O
from	O
its	O
capability	O
of	O
inhibiting	O
tubulin	O
polymerization	O
.	O

The	O
limitations	O
experienced	O
with	O
gallium	B-chem
nitrate	E-chem
and	O
gallium	B-chem
chloride	E-chem
,	O
which	O
call	O
for	O
a	O
prolonged	O
exposure	O
to	O
low	O
steady	O
-	O
state	O
gallium	S-chem
levels	O
in	O
blood	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
adequately	O
exploit	O
the	O
affinity	O
of	O
gallium	S-chem
to	O
tumor	O
tissues	O
and	O
to	O
avoid	O
severe	O
toxic	O
effects	O
,	O
may	O
be	O
overcome	O
by	O
oral	O
gallium	S-chem
complexes	O
such	O
as	O
tris	B-chem
(	I-chem
3	I-chem
-	I-chem
hydroxy	I-chem
-	I-chem
2	I-chem
-	I-chem
methyl	I-chem
-	I-chem
4H	I-chem
-	I-chem
pyran	I-chem
-	I-chem
4	I-chem
-	I-chem
onato	I-chem
)	I-chem
gallium	I-chem
(	I-chem
III	I-chem
)	E-chem
(	O
gallium	B-chem
maltolate	E-chem
)	O
or	O
tris	B-chem
(	I-chem
8	I-chem
-	I-chem
quinolinolato	I-chem
)	I-chem
gallium	I-chem
(	I-chem
III	I-chem
)	E-chem
(	O
KP46	S-chem
)	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
currently	O
being	O
evaluated	O
in	O
clinical	O
trials	O
and	O
show	O
promise	O
to	O
initiate	O
a	O
revival	O
of	O
gallium	S-chem
in	O
the	O
clinical	O
setting	O
.	O

These	O
two	O

,	O
albeit	O
differing	O
in	O
their	O
complex	O
stability	O
,	O
have	O
both	O
been	O
developed	O
with	O
the	O

of	O
providing	O
gallium	S-chem
in	O
a	O

which	O
allows	O
sufficient	O

absorption	O
,	O
but	O
without	O
altering	O
its	O
pharmacodynamic	O
effects	O
.	O

Gallium	S-chem
complexes	O
based	O
on	O
other	O
rationales	O
are	O
scarce	O
and	O
,	O
with	O
regard	O
to	O
the	O
well	O
-	O
known	O
antineoplastic	O
potential	O
of	O
this	O
metal	O
,	O
noticeably	O
under	O
-	O
explored	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
recent	O
approval	O
of	O
arsenic	O
trioxide	S-chem
for	O
the	O
second	O
-	O
line	O
treatment	O
of	O
acute	O
promyelocytic	O
leukemia	O
,	O
the	O
clinical	O
revival	O
of	O
arsenic	S-chem
compounds	O
,	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
the	O
mainstay	O
of	O
antileukemic	O
therapy	O
before	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
modern	O
cancer	O
chemotherapy	O
,	O
has	O
already	O
begun	O
.	O

Currently	O
,	O
strong	O
efforts	O
are	O
being	O
made	O
to	O
explore	O
the	O
activity	O
spectrum	O
in	O
other	O
(	O
less	O
rare	O
)	O
malignancies	O
and	O
to	O
gain	O
a	O
deeper	O
insight	O
into	O
the	O
mode	O
of	O
action	O
.	O

Although	O
this	O
development	O
is	O
currently	O
focusing	O
on	O
arsenic	B-chem
trioxide	E-chem
,	O
it	O
should	O
be	O
suited	O
to	O
stimulate	O
investigations	O
into	O
the	O
therapeutic	O
potential	O
of	O
other	O
arsenic	S-chem
compounds	O
as	O
well	O
.	O

The	O
synaptic	O
vesicle	O
protein	O
SV2A	O
is	O
the	O
binding	O
site	O
for	O
the	O
antiepileptic	O
drug	O
levetiracetam	S-chem
.	O

Here	O
,	O
we	O
show	O
that	O
the	O
synaptic	O
vesicle	O
protein	O
SV2A	O
is	O
the	O
brain	O
binding	O
site	O
of	O
levetiracetam	S-chem
(	O
LEV	S-chem
)	O
,	O
a	O
new	O
antiepileptic	O
drug	O
with	O
a	O
unique	O
activity	O
profile	O
in	O
animal	O
models	O
of	O
seizure	O
and	O
epilepsy	O
.	O

The	O
LEV	S-chem
-	O
binding	O
site	O
is	O
enriched	O
in	O
synaptic	O
vesicles	O
,	O
and	O
photoaffinity	O
labeling	O
of	O
purified	O
synaptic	O
vesicles	O
confirms	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
an	O
apparent	O
molecular	O
mass	O
of	O
approximately	O
90	O
kDa	O
.	O

Brain	O
membranes	O
and	O
purified	O
synaptic	O
vesicles	O
from	O
mice	O
lacking	O

do	O
not	O
bind	O
a	O

LEV	S-chem
derivative	O
,	O
indicating	O
that	O
SV2A	O
is	O
necessary	O
for	O
LEV	S-chem
binding	O
.	O

LEV	S-chem
and	O
related	O
compounds	O
bind	O
to	O
SV2A	O
expressed	O
in	O
fibroblasts	O
,	O
indicating	O
that	O
SV2A	O
is	O
sufficient	O
for	O
LEV	S-chem
binding	O
.	O

No	O
binding	O
was	O
observed	O
to	O
the	O
related	O
isoforms	O

and	O
SV2C	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O

a	O
high	O
degree	O
of	O
correlation	O
between	O
binding	O
affinities	O
of	O
a	O

of	O

derivatives	O
to	O
SV2A	O
in	O
fibroblasts	O
and	O
to	O
the	O
LEV	S-chem
-	O
binding	O
site	O
in	O
brain	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
strong	O
correlation	O
between	O
the	O
affinity	O
of	O
a	O
compound	O
for	O
SV2A	O
and	O
its	O

to	O
protect	O
against	O
seizures	O
in	O
an	O

mouse	O

of	O

.	O

These	O
experimental	O
results	O
suggest	O
that	O
SV2A	O

of	O
LEV	S-chem

of	O

CNS	O
drug	O
therapies	O
.	O

of	O

A	O
novel	O
membrane	O
sensor	O
for	O
histamine	S-chem
H1	O
-	O
receptor	O
antagonist	O
``	O

``	O
.	O

The	O
construction	O
and	O
general	O
performance	O
of	O
thirteen	O
new	O

membrane	O
sensors	O
for	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
fexofenadine	B-chem

based	O
on	O
its	O
ion	O
exchange	O
with	O
reineckate	O
,	O
tetraphenylborate	S-chem
and	O
tetraiodomercurate	S-chem
have	O
been	O
studied	O
.	O

The	O
effects	O
of	O
membrane	O
composition	O
,	O
type	O
of	O
plasticizer	O
,	O
pH	O
value	O
of	O
sample	O
solution	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
analyte	O
in	O
the	O
sensor	O
internal	O
solution	O
have	O
been	O
thoroughly	O
investigated	O
.	O

The	O
novel	O
sensor	O
based	O
on	O
reineckate	O
exchanger	O
shows	O
a	O
stable	O
,	O
potentiometric	O
response	O
for	O
fexofenadine	S-chem
in	O
the	O
concentration	O
range	O
of	O
1	O
x	O
10	O
(	O
-	O
2	O
)	O
-	O
2.5	O
x	O
10	O
(	O
-	O
6	O
)	O
M	O
at	O
25	O
degrees	O
C	O
that	O
is	O
independent	O
of	O
pH	O
in	O
the	O
range	O
of	O
2.0	O
-	O
4.5	O
.	O

The	O
sensor	O
possesses	O
a	O
Nernstian	O
cationic	O
slope	O
of	O
62.3	O
+	O
/	O
-	O
0.7	O
mV	O
/	O
concentration	O
decade	O
and	O
a	O
lower	O
detection	O
limit	O
of	O
1.3	O
x	O
10	O
(	O
-	O
6	O
)	O
M	O
with	O
a	O
fast	O
response	O
time	O
of	O
20	O
-	O
40	O
s	O
.	O

Selectivity	O
coefficients	O
for	O
a	O

of	O
interfering	O
ions	O
and	O
excipients	O
relative	O
to	O
fexofenadine	S-chem
were	O

.	O

from	O

,	O
anions	O
,	O
and	O
pharmaceutical	O

,	O

,	O
citrizine	S-chem
that	O

to	O

of	O

of	O

in	O

(	O

.	O

.	O

Thymidylate	S-chem
synthase	O
:	O
a	O
critical	O
target	O
in	O
cancer	O
therapy	O
?	O

For	O
the	O
last	O
four	O
decades	O
,	O
synthesis	O
and	O
testing	O
of	O
potentially	O
active	O
drugs	O
(	O
e.g	O
.	O
,	O
antimetabolites	O
)	O
have	O
focused	O
on	O
structural	O
modification	O
of	O
existing	O
metabolites	O
as	O
precursors	O
of	O
DNA	O
and	O
RNA	O
synthesis	O
.	O

In	O
recent	O
years	O
,	O
the	O
focus	O
has	O
shifted	O
to	O
synthesis	O
of	O
target	O
-	O
specific	O
agents	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
the	O
current	O
emphasis	O
of	O
drug	O
development	O
is	O
directed	O
at	O
inhibiting	O
specific	O
target	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
expressed	O
preferentially	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
exclusively	O
,	O
in	O
tumor	O
tissues	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
ultimate	O
goal	O
of	O
improving	O
the	O
therapeutic	O
efficacy	O
and	O
selectivity	O
of	O
these	O
new	O
agents	O
.	O

Preclinically	O
,	O
proof	O
-	O
of	O
-	O
principle	O
studies	O
were	O
carried	O
out	O
in	O
tumors	O
with	O
specific	O
expression	O
of	O
the	O
intended	O
target	O
.	O

With	O

of	O
translating	O
preclinical	O
findings	O
to	O
the	O
design	O
of	O
implementation	O
of	O
clinical	O
trials	O
.	O

Thymidylate	S-chem
synthase	O
(	O
TS	O
)	O
continues	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
critical	O
target	O
for	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
fluorouracil	E-chem
(	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
FU	E-chem
)	O
and	O
its	O
prodrugs	O
,	O
UFT	S-chem
/	O
LV	S-chem
(	O
Orzel	S-chem
)	O
,	O
capecitabine	S-chem
(	O
Xeloda	S-chem
)	O
,	O
and	O
S	B-chem
-	I-chem
1	E-chem
,	O
primarily	O
because	O
this	O
enzyme	O
is	O
essential	O
for	O
the	O
synthesis	O
of	O
2	B-chem
-	I-chem
deoxythymidine	I-chem
-	I-chem
5	I-chem
-	I-chem
monophosphate	E-chem
,	O
a	O
precursor	O
for	O
DNA	O
synthesis	O
.	O

While	O
fluoropyrimidine	S-chem

have	O
other	O
sites	O
of	O
action	O
,	O
antifolates	O

(	O

)	O
and	O
AG337	S-chem
(	O

)	O
are	O
more	O
specific	O
and	O
potent	O

.	O

Thus	O
,	O

is	O

that	O

of	O

result	O
in	O

of	O
molecular	O
markers	O

with	O

and	O

to	O

It	O

also	O

to	O

that	O

and	O

of	O

enzyme	O

on	O
the	O
expression	O
level	O
of	O
the	O
target	O
enzyme	O
,	O
thymidylate	O
synthase	O
.	O

Correlative	O
studies	O
in	O
preclinical	O
and	O
clinical	O
systems	O
demonstrated	O
a	O
close	O
relationship	O
between	O
the	O
enzyme	O
level	O
(	O
mRNA	O
and	O
protein	O
)	O
and	O
response	O
to	O
therapy	O
of	O
colorectal	O
cancer	O
patients	O
treated	O
with	O
fluoropyrimidine	S-chem
or	O
Tomudex	S-chem
.	O

However	O
,	O
significant	O
overlap	O
was	O
demonstrated	O
between	O
responders	O
and	O
non	O
-	O
responders	O
.	O

These	O
data	O
are	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O

that	O

of	O

to	O

and	O
TS	O
is	O
one	O
target	O
.	O

,	O

of	O

patients	O
to	O
a	O

,	O

are	O
different	O
.	O

5	B-chem
-	I-chem
FU	E-chem

that	O

-	I-chem

tumor	O

and	O
