activity	O
,	O

,	O
and	O

were	O
also	O

.	O

Our	O

that	O
remikiren	S-chem
was	O

as	O
cilazapril	S-chem
and	O

than	O

38560A	E-chem
or	O

in	O

in	O
our	O

model	O
.	O

Interestingly	O

-	O

One	O

that	O

to	O

in	O
a	O

important	O

compartment	O
.	O

Inhibition	O
of	O
cytokine	O
-	O

by	O
nedocromil	B-chem
sodium	E-chem
.	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
Eosinophil	O
influx	O
into	O
the	O
lung	O
tissue	O
is	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
relevant	O
for	O
the	O
pathogenesis	O
of	O
asthma	O
.	O

Various	O
chemotactic	O
factors	O
may	O
be	O
responsible	O
for	O
this	O
influx	O
.	O

Recently	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
demonstrated	O
that	O
the	O
cytokines	O

-	O

colony	O
-	O
stimulating	O
factor	O
(	O
GM	O
-	O
CSF	O
)	O
,	O

-	O
3	O
(	O
IL	O
-	O
3	O
)	O

and	O
interleukin	O
-	O
5	O
(	O
IL	O
-	O
5	O
)	O
are	O
present	O
in	O
the	O
circulation	O
of	O
individuals	O
with	O
allergic	O

.	O

These	O

have	O

to	O

of	O

toward	O
platelet	O
-	O

factor	O
,	O
formyl	B-chem
-	I-chem

-	I-chem

,	O
(	O
FMLP	S-chem
)	O
and	O
neutrophil	O
-	O
activating	O
factor	O
(	O
NAF	O
)	O
/	O
IL	O
-	O
8	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
toward	O
complement	O
fragment	O
C5a	O
(	O
C5a	O
)	O
.	O

Here	O
the	O

of	O
nedocromil	B-chem
sodium	E-chem
on	O

response	O
of	O

from	O

.	O

:	O

approximately	O
60	O
%	O
(	O

of	O

[	O

1	O
to	O
10	O
nmol	O
/	O

(	O
0.1	O

/	O

)	O

Leukotrienes	S-chem
in	O

Our	O

(	O

was	O
observed	O
(	O
30	O

after	O

)	O
.	O

(	O

as	O

.	O

The	O

,	O

.	O

reduced	O

that	O

inhibits	O
the	O
increased	O
systemic	O
generation	O
of	O
conjugated	O
dienes	O
after	O
blast	O
injury	O
.	O

Although	O

exerts	O
local	O

activity	O
with	O
beneficial	O
effects	O
on	O
lung	O
tissue	O

this	O
5	O
-	O
LO	O
inhibitor	O

the	O
blast	O

caused	O
hemodynamic	O
insufficiency	O
.	O

Tamsulosin	S-chem
,	O
the	O
first	O
prostate	O
-	O

alpha	O

-	O

meta	O

of	O

(	O

)	O
.	O
European	O
Tamsulosin	S-chem
Study	O
Group	O
.	O

OBJECTIVE	O
:	O
This	O
meta	O
-	O
analysis	O
of	O

:	O

patients	O

CONCLUSION	O
:	O
Tamsulosin	S-chem
0.4	O
mg	O
once	O
daily	O
is	O
safe	O
,	O
well	O
-	O
tolerated	O
and	O

both	O
the	O
symptoms	O
and	O
urinary	O
flow	O
rate	O
in	O
patients	O
with	O
benign	O
prostatic	O
obstruction	O
(	O
symptomatic	O
BPH	O
)	O
.	O

Human	O
prohormone	O
convertase	O
3	O
gene	O
:	O
exon	O
-	O
intron	O
organization	O
and	O
molecular	O
scanning	O
for	O
mutations	O
in	O
Japanese	O
subjects	O
with	O
NIDDM	O
.	O

Proinsulin	O
is	O
converted	O
to	O
insulin	O
by	O
the	O
concerted	O
action	O
of	O
two	O
sequence	O
-	O
specific	O
subtilisin	O
-	O
like	O
proteases	O
termed	O
prohormone	O
convertase	O
2	O
(	O
PC2	O
)	O
and	O
prohormone	O
convertase	O
3	O
(	O
PC3	O
)	O
.	O

PC3	O
is	O
a	O
type	O
I	O
proinsulin	O
-	O
processing	O
enzyme	O
that	O
initiates	O
the	O
sequential	O
processing	O
of	O
proinsulin	O
to	O
insulin	O
by	O
cleaving	O
the	O
proinsulin	O
molecule	O
on	O
the	O
COOH	S-chem
-	O
terminal	O
side	O
of	O
the	O
dibasic	O
peptide	O
,	O
Arg31	O
-	O
Arg32	O
,	O
joining	O
the	O
B	O
-	O
chain	O
and	O
C	S-chem
-	O
peptide	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
PC3	O
plays	O
a	O
key	O
role	O
in	O
regulating	O
insulin	O
biosynthesis	O
.	O

Expressions	O
of	O
insulin	O
and	O
PC3	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
PC2	O
,	O
are	O
coordinately	O
regulated	O
by	O
glucose	S-chem
,	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
important	O
role	O
of	O
PC3	O
in	O
regulating	O
proinsulin	O
processing	O
.	O

NIDDM	O
is	O
associated	O
with	O
increased	O
secretion	O
of	O
proinsulin	O
and	O
proinsulin	O
-	O
like	O
molecules	O
,	O
suggesting	O
that	O
mutations	O
in	O
the	O
PC3	O
gene	O
may	O
be	O
involved	O
in	O
the	O
development	O
of	O
this	O
disorder	O
.	O

To	O
examine	O
this	O
hypothesis	O
,	O
we	O
have	O
isolated	O
and	O
characterized	O
the	O
human	O
PC3	O
gene	O
and	O
screened	O
it	O
for	O
mutations	O
in	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
Japanese	O
subjects	O
with	O
NIDDM	O
.	O

The	O
PC3	O
gene	O
consists	O
of	O
14	O
exons	O
spanning	O
more	O
than	O
35	O
kb	O
.	O

The	O
exon	O
-	O
intron	O
organization	O
of	O
PC2	O
and	O
PC3	O
genes	O
are	O
conserved	O
,	O
consistent	O
with	O
a	O
common	O
evolutionary	O
origin	O
for	O
the	O
prohormone	O
convertase	O
gene	O
family	O
.	O

Single	O
-	O
strand	O
conformational	O
analysis	O
and	O
nucleotide	S-chem
sequencing	O
of	O
the	O
entire	O
coding	O
region	O
of	O
the	O
PC3	O
gene	O
in	O
102	O
Japanese	O
subjects	O
with	O
NIDDM	O
revealed	O
missense	O
mutations	O
in	O
exons	O
2	O
(	O
Arg	O
/	O
Gln53	O
)	O
and	O
14	O
(	O
Gln	O
/	O
Glu638	O
)	O
,	O
neither	O
of	O
which	O
was	O
associated	O
with	O
NIDDM	O
in	O
this	O
population	O
.	O

These	O
data	O
suggest	O
that	O
genetic	O
variation	O
in	O
the	O
PC3	O
gene	O
is	O
unlikely	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
major	O
contributor	O
to	O
NIDDM	O
susceptibility	O
in	O
Japanese	O
.	O

Desipramine	S-chem
administration	O
in	O
the	O
olfactory	O

rat	O

changes	O
in	O

7	O
.	O

The	O
present	O
results	O
suggest	O
that	O

may	O

in	O
frontal	O
cortical	O
5	O
-	O
HT2A	O
receptors	O
.	O

Binding	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
to	O
alpha1	O
-	O
acid	O
glycoprotein	O
may	O
be	O
involved	O
in	O
its	O
inhibition	O
of	O
tumor	O
necrosis	O
factor	O
alpha	O
production	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
to	O
its	O
well	O
known	O
sedative	O
and	O
teratogenic	O
effects	O
,	O
thalidomide	O
also	O
possesses	O
potent	O
immunomodulatory	O
and	O
antiinflammatory	O
activities	O
,	O
being	O
most	O
effective	O
against	O
leprosy	O
and	O
chronic	O
graft	O
-	O
versus	O
-	O
host	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
immunomodulatory	O
activity	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
has	O
been	O
ascribed	O
to	O
the	O
selective	O
inhibition	O
of	O
tumor	O
necrosis	O
factor	O
alpha	O
from	O
monocytes	O
.	O

The	O
molecular	O
mechanism	O
for	O
the	O
immunomodulatory	O
effect	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
remains	O
unknown	O
.	O

To	O
elucidate	O
this	O
mechanism	O
,	O
we	O
synthesized	O
an	O
active	O
photoaffinity	O
label	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
as	O
a	O
probe	O
to	O
identify	O
the	O
molecular	O
target	O
of	O
the	O
drug	O
.	O

Using	O
the	O
probe	O
,	O
we	O
specifically	O
labeled	O
a	O
pair	O
of	O
proteins	O
of	O
43	O
-	O
45	O
kDa	O
with	O
high	O
acidity	O
from	O
bovine	O
thymus	O
extract	O
.	O

Purification	O
of	O
these	O
proteins	O
and	O
partial	O
peptide	O
sequence	O
determination	O
revealed	O
them	O
to	O
be	O
alpha1	O
-	O
acid	O
glycoprotein	O
(	O
AGP	O
)	O
.	O

We	O
show	O
that	O
the	O
binding	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
photoaffinity	O
label	O
to	O
authentic	O
human	O
AGP	O
is	O
competed	O
with	O
both	O
thalidomide	S-chem
and	O
the	O
nonradioactive	O
photoaffinity	O
label	O
at	O
concentrations	O
comparable	O
to	O
those	O
required	O
for	O
inhibition	O
of	O
production	O
of	O
tumor	O
necrosis	O
factor	O
alpha	O
from	O
human	O
monocytes	O
,	O
suggesting	O
that	O
AGP	O
may	O
be	O
involved	O
in	O
the	O
immunomodulatory	O
activity	O
of	O
thalidomide	S-chem
.	O

AMPA	S-chem
receptor	O
heterogeneity	O
in	O
rat	O
hippocampal	O
neurons	O
revealed	O
by	O
differential	O
sensitivity	O
to	O
cyclothiazide	S-chem
.	O

1	O
.	O

The	O
kinetics	O
of	O
onset	O
of	O
alpha	B-chem
-	I-chem
amino	I-chem
-	I-chem
3	I-chem
-	I-chem
hydroxy	I-chem
-	I-chem
5	I-chem
-	I-chem
methyl	I-chem
-	I-chem
4	I-chem
-	I-chem
isoxazolepropionic	I-chem
acid	E-chem
(	O
AMPA	S-chem
)	O
receptor	O
desensitization	O
by	O
glutamate	S-chem
,	O
and	O

extent	O
of	O

of	O
AMPA	S-chem
receptor	O
desensitization	O
by	O
cyclothiazide	S-chem
,	O
showed	O
pronounced	O

-	O
to	O
-	O
cell	O
variation	O
in	O
cultures	O
of	O
rat	O

.	O

area	O

stratum	O

to	O

than	O

.	O

2	O
.	O

Kinetic	O
analysis	O
of	O
concentration	O
jump	O
responses	O
to	O
glutamate	S-chem
revealed	O

of	O
receptors	O
with	O
fast	O
(	O
approximately	O
400	O
ms	O
)	O
,	O
intermediate	O
(	O
approximately	O
2	O

Activation	O
of	O
cytoprotective	O
prostaglandin	S-chem
synthase	O
-	O
1	O
by	O
minoxidil	S-chem
as	O
a	O

for	O
its	O
hair	O
growth	O
-	O
stimulating	O
effect	O
.	O

Data	O
from	O
the	O
literature	O
indicate	O
that	O
nonsteroidal	O
anti	O
-	O
inflammatory	O
drugs	O
(	O

)	O
,	O
such	O
as	O

,	O

,	O

,	O
or	O

,	O
induce	O
hair	O
loss	O
in	O
vivo	O
.	O

These	O

are	O
well	O
-	O
known	O
inhibitors	O
of	O
both	O
the	O
cytoprotective	O
isoform	O
of	O
prostaglandin	S-chem
endoperoxide	O
synthase	O
-	O
1	O
(	O
PGHS	O
-	O
1	O
)	O
and	O
of	O
the	O
inducible	O
form	O
(	O
PGHS	O
-	O
2	O
)	O
.	O

that	O

-	O

is	O

present	O
in	O
the	O

from	O

(	O
either	O

or	O

was	O

expressed	O
in	O
anagen	O

papilla	O

-	O

might	O
be	O

target	O
of	O
the	O
hair	O
growth	O

of	O

of	O

by	O
which	O

(	O
2,4	B-chem
-	I-chem
diamino	I-chem
-	I-chem
6	I-chem
-	I-chem
piperidinopyrimidine	I-chem
-	I-chem
3	I-chem
-	I-chem

.	O

common	O
conditions	O
.	O

Pharmacology	O
and	O
chemistry	O
of	O
adapalene	S-chem
.	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
Retinoid	S-chem
research	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
of	O
dermatology	O
has	O
been	O
influenced	O
by	O
the	O
clinical	O
success	O
of	O
topical	O
tretinoin	S-chem
and	O
oral	O
isotretinoin	S-chem
in	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
acne	O
,	O
and	O
by	O
the	O
discovery	O
of	O
high	O
-	O
affinity	O
binding	O
proteins	O
for	O
retinoic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
mediating	O
its	O
action	O
and	O
interaction	O
with	O
other	O
vitamins	S-chem
and	O
hormones	O
.	O

OBJECTIVE	O
:	O
We	O
sought	O
molecules	O
with	O
an	O
optimal	O
balance	O
between	O
stability	O
,	O
efficacy	O
,	O
and	O
local	O
tolerance	O
for	O
topical	O
acne	O
therapy	O
.	O

METHODS	O
:	O
In	O
vitro	O
and	O
in	O
vivo	O
bioassay	O
systems	O
were	O
used	O
to	O
test	O
the	O
ability	O
of	O
retinoids	S-chem
to	O
modulate	O
cell	O
proliferation	O
and	O
differentiation	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
antiinflammatory	O
properties	O
were	O
assessed	O
.	O

Binding	O
and	O
transactivation	O
assays	O
were	O
used	O
to	O
compare	O
affinities	O
and	O
transcriptional	O
activities	O
of	O
adapalene	S-chem
and	O
tretinoin	S-chem
for	O
the	O
nuclear	O
transcription	O
factors	O
,	O
retinoic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
receptors	O
(	O
RARs	O
)	O
.	O

RESULTS	O
AND	O
CONCLUSION	O
:	O
Adapalene	S-chem
is	O
a	O
stable	O
naphthoic	B-chem
acid	E-chem
derivative	O
with	O
potent	O
retinoid	S-chem
pharmacology	O
,	O
controlling	O
cell	O
proliferation	O
and	O
differentiation	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
it	O
has	O
significant	O
antiinflammatory	O
action	O
.	O

The	O
nuclear	O
gene	O
transcription	O
factors	O
RAR	O
beta	O
and	O
RAR	O
gamma	O
mediate	O
the	O
retinoid	S-chem
activity	O
of	O
adapalene	S-chem
.	O

Cinitapride	S-chem
protects	O
against	O
ethanol	S-chem
-	O
induced	O
gastric	O
mucosal	O
injury	O
in	O
rats	O
:	O
role	O
of	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
hydroxytryptamine	E-chem
,	O
prostaglandins	S-chem
and	O
sulfhydryl	S-chem
compounds	O
.	O

This	O
study	O
was	O
designed	O
to	O
determine	O

properties	O
of	O
cinitapride	S-chem
(	O

)	O

a	O

agonist	O
of	O
5	O
-	O

and	O

and	O
5	O

injury	O
produced	O
by	O
50	O
%	O
(	O
v	O
/	O
v	O
)	O
ethanol	S-chem
.	O

Results	O
were	O
compared	O
with	O

for	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
hydroxytryptamine	E-chem
(	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem

:	O
10	O
mg	O
kg	O
-	O
1	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
possible	O
involvements	O
of	O
gastric	O
mucus	O
secretion	O
,	O
endogenous	O

(	O

)	O
and	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

(	O

and	O
1	O
mg	O

(	O
1	O
mg	O

-	O

values	O
.	O

On	O

-	I-chem

.	O

The	O
present	O
results	O
demonstrate	O

could	O
be	O
also	O
involved	O
.	O

Adenosine	S-chem
deaminase	O
is	O
a	O
specific	O
partner	O
for	O
the	O
Grb2	O
isoform	O
Grb3	O
-	O
3	O
.	O

Grb3	O
-	O
3	O
is	O
an	O
isoform	O
of	O
Grb2	O
,	O
thought	O
to	O
arise	O
by	O
alternative	O

lacks	O
a	O

but	O
retains	O
functional	O

which	O
allow	O
interaction	O
with	O
other	O

through	O

to	O
prolinerich	O

.	O

Several	O
evidences	O
suggest	O
that	O
besides	O
common	O

for	O

and	O
Grb3	O
-	O

targets	O
could	O
exist	O
.	O

In	O

find	O

for	O

-	O
3	O
,	O
we	O
have	O
screened	O
a	O

library	O
by	O
the	O
yeast	O
two	O
-	O
hybrid	O
system	O
with	O
Grb3	O
-	O
3	O
as	O
a	O
bait	O
.	O

We	O
have	O
identified	O
adenosine	S-chem
deaminase	O
,	O
an	O

involved	O
in	O

whose	O

is	O
associated	O
with	O

protein	O

to	O

.	O

This	O

-	O

.	O

The	O
functional	O
significance	O
of	O
this	O
finding	O
is	O
discussed	O
.	O

Alendronate	S-chem
inhibition	O
of	O
protein	O
-	O
tyrosine	S-chem
-	O
phosphatase	O
-	O
meg1	O
.	O

Alendronate	S-chem
(	O
4	B-chem
-	I-chem
amino	I-chem
-	I-chem
1	I-chem
-	I-chem
hydroxybutylidene	I-chem
-	I-chem
1,1	I-chem
-	I-chem
bisphosphonate	E-chem
)	O
is	O
a	O
potent	O
bisphosphonate	S-chem
that	O
inhibits	O
osteoclastic	O
bone	O
resorption	O
and	O
has	O
proven	O
effective	O
for	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
osteoporosis	O
.	O

Its	O
molecular	O
mechanism	O
of	O
action	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
defined	O
precisely	O
.	O

Here	O
we	O
report	O
that	O
alendronate	S-chem
is	O
a	O
potent	O
inhibitor	O
of	O
the	O
protein	O
-	O
tyrosine	S-chem
-	O
phosphatase	O
-	O
meg1	O
(	O
PTPmeg1	O
)	O
.	O

Two	O
substrates	O
were	O
employed	O
in	O
this	O
study	O
:	O
fluorescein	O
diphosphate	S-chem
and	O
the	O
phosphotyrosyl	O
peptide	O
src	O
-	O
pY527	O
.	O

With	O
either	O
substrate	O
,	O
alendronate	S-chem
was	O
a	O
slow	O
binding	O
inhibitor	O
of	O
PTPmeg1	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
other	O
bisphosphonates	S-chem
studied	O
,	O
alendronate	S-chem
was	O
more	O
potent	O
and	O
selective	O
for	O
PTPmeg1	O
.	O

The	O
hydrolysis	O
of	O
fluorescein	O
diphosphate	S-chem
by	O
PTP	O
epsilon	O
and	O
PTPmeg1	O
was	O
sensitive	O
to	O
alendronate	S-chem
,	O
with	O
IC50	O
values	O
of	O
less	O
than	O
1	O
microM	O
;	O
PTPsigma	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
under	O
the	O
same	O
conditions	O
,	O
was	O
inhibited	O
by	O
only	O
50	O
%	O
with	O
141	O
microM	O
alendronate	S-chem
.	O

Similarly	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
src	O
-	O
pY527	O
substrate	O
,	O
alendronate	S-chem
inhibition	O
was	O
also	O
PTP	O
dependent	O
.	O

Alendronate	S-chem
inhibited	O
PTPmeg1	O
with	O
an	O
IC50	O
value	O
of	O
23	O
microM	O
,	O
PTPsigma	O
with	O
an	O
IC50	O
value	O
of	O
2	O
microM	O
,	O
and	O
did	O
not	O
inhibit	O
PTP	O
epsilon	O
at	O
concentrations	O
up	O
to	O
1	O
mM	O
.	O

The	O
alendronate	S-chem
inhibition	O
of	O
these	O
three	O
PTPs	O
and	O
two	O
substrates	O
is	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
formation	O
of	O
a	O
ternary	O
complex	O
comprised	O
of	O
enzyme	O
,	O
substrate	O
,	O
and	O
inhibitor	O
.	O

PTP	O
inhibition	O
by	O
hisphosphonates	S-chem
or	O
vanadate	S-chem
was	O
diminished	O
by	O
the	O
metal	O
chelating	O
agent	O
EDTA	S-chem
,	O
or	O
by	O
the	O
reducing	O
agent	O
dithiothreitol	S-chem
,	O
suggesting	O
that	O
a	O
metal	O
ion	O
and	O
the	O
oxidation	O
of	O
a	O
cysteine	S-chem
residue	O
are	O
required	O
for	O
full	O
inhibition	O
.	O

These	O
observations	O
show	O
substrate	O
-	O
and	O
enzyme	O
-	O
specific	O

inhibition	O
by	O
alendronate	S-chem

(	O

.	O

Thymidine	S-chem
kinase	O
from	O
Herpes	O
simplex	O
virus	O
type	O
1	O
(	O
TK	O
)	O
was	O

in	O
an	O
N	S-chem
-	O

truncated	O
but	O
fully	O
active	O
form	O
.	O

The	O
structures	O
of	O
TK	O
complexed	O
with	O
ADP	S-chem
at	O
the	O
ATP	S-chem
-	O
site	O
and	O
deoxythymidine	B-chem
-	I-chem
5	I-chem
'	I-chem
-	I-chem
monophosphate	E-chem
(	O
dTMP	S-chem
)	O
,	O
deoxythymidine	S-chem
(	O
dT	S-chem
)	O
,	O
or	O
idoxuridine	B-chem
-	I-chem
5	I-chem
'	I-chem
-	I-chem
phosphate	E-chem
(	O
5	B-chem
-	I-chem
iodo	I-chem
-	I-chem
dUMP	E-chem
)	O
at	O
the	O
substrate	O
-	O
site	O
were	O
refined	O
to	O
2.75	O
A	O
,	O
2.8	O
A	O
,	O
and	O
3.0	O
A	O
resolution	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

TK	S-chem
catalyzes	O
the	O
phosphorylation	O
of	O
dT	S-chem
resulting	O
in	O
an	O
ester	S-chem
,	O
and	O
the	O
phosphorylation	O
of	O
dTMP	S-chem
giving	O
rise	O
to	O
an	O
anhydride	S-chem
.	O

The	O
presented	O
TK	S-chem
structures	O
indicate	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
only	O
small	O
differences	O
between	O
these	O
two	O
modes	O
of	O
action	O
.	O

Glu83	O
serves	O
as	O
a	O
general	O
base	O
in	O
the	O
ester	S-chem
reaction	O
.	O

Arg163	O
parks	O
at	O
an	O
internal	O
aspartate	S-chem
during	O
ester	S-chem
formation	O
and	O
binds	O
the	O
alpha	B-chem
-	I-chem
phosphate	E-chem
of	O
dTMP	S-chem
during	O
anhydride	S-chem
formation	O
.	O

The	O
bound	O
deoxythymidine	S-chem
leaves	O
a	O
35	O
A3	O
cavity	O
at	O
position	O
5	O
of	O
the	O
base	O
and	O
two	O
sequestered	O
water	O
molecules	O
at	O
position	O
2	O
.	O

Cavity	O
and	O
water	O
molecules	O
reduce	O
the	O
substrate	O
specificity	O
to	O
such	O
an	O
extent	O
that	O
TK	S-chem
can	O
phosphorylate	S-chem
various	O
substrate	O
analogues	O
useful	O
in	O
pharmaceutical	O
applications	O
.	O

TK	S-chem
is	O
structurally	O
homologous	O
to	O
the	O
well	O
-	O
known	O
nucleoside	B-chem
monophosphate	E-chem
kinases	O
but	O
contains	O
large	O
additional	O
peptide	O
segments	O
.	O

Blockage	O
of	O
the	O
HERG	O
human	O
cardiac	O
K	B-chem
+	E-chem
channel	O
by	O
the	O
gastrointestinal	O
prokinetic	O
agent	O
cisapride	S-chem
.	O

Cisapride	S-chem
,	O
a	O
gastrointestinal	O
prokinetic	O
agent	O
,	O
is	O
known	O
to	O
cause	O
long	O
Q	O
-	O
T	O
syndrome	O
and	O
ventricular	O
arrhythmias	O
.	O

The	O
cellular	O
mechanism	O
is	O
not	O
known	O
.	O

The	O
human	O
ether	O
-	O
a	O
-	O
go	O
-	O
go	O
-	O
related	O
gene	O
(	O
HERG	O
)	O
,	O
which	O
encodes	O
the	O
rapidly	O
activating	O
delayed	O
rectifier	O
K	B-chem
+	E-chem
current	O
and	O
is	O
important	O
in	O
cardiac	O
repolarization	O
,	O
may	O
serve	O
as	O
a	O
target	O
for	O
the	O
action	O
of	O
cisapride	S-chem
.	O

We	O
tested	O
the	O
hypothesis	O
that	O
cisapride	S-chem
blocks	O
HERG	O
.	O

The	O
whole	O
cell	O
patch	O
-	O
clamp	O
recording	O
technique	O
was	O
used	O
to	O
study	O
HERG	O
channels	O
stably	O
expressed	O
heterologously	O
in	O
HEK293	O
cells	O
.	O

Under	O
voltage	O
-	O
clamp	O
conditions	O
,	O
cisapride	S-chem
block	O
of	O
HERG	O
is	O
dose	O
dependent	O
with	O
a	O
half	O
-	O
maximal	O
inhibitory	O
concentration	O
of	O
6.5	O
nM	O
at	O
22	O
degrees	O
C	O
(	O
n	O
=	O
25	O
cells	O
)	O
.	O

Currents	O
rapidly	O
recovered	O
with	O
drug	O
washout	O
.	O

The	O
onset	O
of	O
block	O
by	O
cisapride	S-chem
required	O
channel	O
activation	O
indicative	O
of	O
open	O
or	O
inactivated	O
state	O
blockage	O
.	O

Block	O
of	O
HERG	O
with	O
cisapride	S-chem
after	O
channel	O
activation	O
was	O
voltage	O
dependent	O
.	O

At	O
-	O
20	O
mV	O
,	O
10	O
nM	O
cisapride	S-chem
reduced	O
HERG	O
tail	O
-	O
current	O
amplitude	O
by	O
5	O
%	O
,	O
whereas	O
,	O
at	O
+	O
20	O
mV	O
,	O
the	O
tail	O
-	O
current	O
amplitude	O
was	O
reduced	O
by	O
45	O
%	O
(	O
n	O
=	O
4	O
cells	O
)	O
.	O

At	O
-	O
20	O
and	O
+	O
20	O
mV	O
,	O
100	O
nM	O
cisapride	S-chem
reduced	O
tail	O
-	O
current	O
amplitude	O
by	O
66	O
and	O
90	O
%	O
,	O
respectively	O
.	O

We	O
conclude	O
that	O
cisapride	S-chem
is	O
a	O
potent	O
blocker	O
of	O
HERG	O
channels	O
expressed	O
in	O
HEK293	O
cells	O
.	O

This	O
effect	O
may	O
account	O
for	O
the	O
clinical	O
occurrence	O
of	O
Q	O
-	O
T	O
prolongation	O
and	O
ventricular	O
arrhythmias	O
observed	O
with	O
cisapride	S-chem
.	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

(	O

age	O
)	O

.	O

-	I-chem

Crystallographic	O

of	O

The	O
aromatic	B-chem
amino	I-chem
acid	E-chem
hydroxylases	O
represent	O
a	O

.	O

(	O

Glucocorticoids	O
(	O

)	O
influence	O
a	O

of	O

.	O
